Had a wonderful time during our training conference, My room was very nice, modern with all the comforts of home. All staff members I encountered were friendly and professional. One of the BEST Crowne Plaza I've stayed at!

I stayed at the Crown Plaza Hotel & Javier was there to help me out. I had arrived at the hotel but wanted to check in earlier than expected cause I had a tee time @ 2 Javier looked up his computer and I was ready to check in. Javier asked me about golf & said we have a bar & great food and he was right. The bartender Mark was very knowledgeable about wines & mix drinks. I would stay @ the hotel again cause of Javier.

Great staff and available services.  Manager (Sebastian I believe) was extremely helpful in providing guidance in the local area.  Clean comfortable rooms and pool facilities.  Great bar beside the lobby and ample parking.  Conveniently located to shopping and some fantastic restaurants.  We will stay here again.

I'm giving this hotel 3 stars ONLY because of the manager. I stayed at this hotel over a year ago for business and had a good experience. I was again on a business trip and because of my previous experience I decided to stay at this hotel.   The front desk staff is not sincere or very accommodating. The front desk person (a guy) could not find my IHG account and directed me to find it myself. Another staff (a woman) apparently found my IHG account. She however doesn't know how to smile at customers or be friendly. Then the guy, who checked me in, gave me a room on the second floor and gave me directions to the wrong side of the building. I was exhausted after driving about 3 hours... I went back to the front desk and they apologized (not very sincerely) for giving me the wrong
Manager Response: Dear Picollo99,  Thank you very much for your recent stay.  We are very sorry to hear of the challenging time you faced while interacting with our employees.  The information provided is vital to the continual growth and success of our company and will be used as a training tool for our employees.    We hope that we can welcome you back to our property should you find yourself in the area once again.  Please call me directly with any questions and/or if I can book your next stay at 714 557 3000.  Warm regards,  Aldo Casanova Guest Service Manager

Summary: We've stayed here multiple times in the past and each and every time, the staff have been one of the best we have ever encountered.  We travel a moderate amount and have stayed in numerous hotels and this is certainly one of the better ones, because of the staff.  They were especially helpful with any requests we had and truly seemed to do whatever they could to help us get our needs met.  The room itself is a comfortable size and the decor is in good condition.  The breakfast buffet is one of the better ones we have had.  Central to many attractions as we used it as our home base.  Again, it is the service that truly sets this hotel apart and I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting the area.

After a long day of traveling, I arrived at this hotel at 7 PM.  I went to the front desk and told Sebastian (yes, I'm naming names) that I had a reservation.  He was super cocky and told me my room wasn't ready yet so I'd have to wait.  Not ready at 7 PM?? Again he repeated that I'd have to wait.  He wasn't helpful or apologetic at all!! I asked to speak to a manager, and funnily enough, she found, right away, a room with a king-size bed.  Definitely not a good first impression of the place.  Now the room.  It was shabby, worn-out looking.  Smelled of stale cigarettes. There were stains on the carpet. The towels had hairs on them. The A/C unit was incredibly loud, although it did drown out the noise coming from the pool area, which was right outside my window.  They advertise
Manager Response: Dear Lori T,  Thank you for your recent visit to our property.  We are very sorry for the terrible experience you had at our hotel.  We are currently investigating the situation with our management team.  We hope your visit will not discourage your from visiting one of our many IHG Hotels located around the world.  If you have any further questions or concerns please contact me directly at 714 557 3000.   Warm regards,  Aldo Casanova Guest Service Manager

Summary: Besides the hotel being a great location to the 405 freeway and to McDonald's next store, the hotel is well-maintained and the hotel staff are pleasant and helpful.  Also, I was very pleased with the way the hotel staff helped me solve a problem with a charge on my credit card.  Thanks!

After another return visit to this hotel, im still surprised at how helpful and friendly the staff are. They literally go above and beyond to help you. Theyre very welcoming and I cant sing their praises highly enough, especially Javier and Josh at reception. The hotel is in a great location, with the hotel running complimentary shuttle buses. The rooms are great with very comfortable beds. I would make this hotel your number one choice if youre staying in Costa Mesa.

Summary Heading: Very good food and great service.
Summary: The food was great, and I found the staff helpful and friendly, especially the early morning service in the restaurant. I would have given it a higher review but the rooms need a facelift. I loved the design but some things were a bit worn, paint needed a touchup, etc. For my purposes the location worked well.

Stayed here for two nights using rewards points then extended staying another two nights. Room was a large suite, clean, a great room for two adults and two children. We used this as a base whilst visiting Disneyland, Huntington Beach and the balboa island areas. The front desk staff, Janet was extremely helpful with any request or help needed when extending stay not once but twice. Would definitely stay here again.

A great location however, the property lacked the attention that it truly needed.  Although the design and finishes were well thought out, I noticed many scratches, dents and chips in the paint and wall coverings.  The carpet was stained on the third floor and worn in the entry of my room.  The fitness center had equipment that was in need of repair and squeaked so much that other guests commented that it sounded like a porch swing.  To top it off, the elevator was out of order.  I don't mind taking the stairs to the third floor, but I dislike carrying luggage and heavy bags down.  I hope my company doesn't book me here again!
Manager Response: Dear LucyLeo50,  Thank you for your recent visit to our hotel.  We are very sorry to hear of the challenging time you faced with the quality of your room and overall experience.  Your vital feedback is greatly appreciated, and has been communicated to the hotel management staff.  The hotel is currently looking to make carpet upgrades along with some yearly maintenance in some of our rooms.  We would very much like to welcome you back if you should find yourself in the area again.  Please reach out to me personally at 714 557 3000 with any questions and/or to book another stay.  Warm regards,  Aldo Casanova Guest Service Manager

Summary: I managed to mess up the booking time for my business trip, coming in a day later than I'd booked for.  After struggling to find me, Alex and the front desk staff went above and beyond to get me into the last room in the hotel. This was a really important stay - I had a big business meeting that evening - and knowing that the front desk team did everything they could to help me out was a blessing.  My original booking included breakfast, however that wasn't included in the shifted reservation. Not a trouble for Jeanette (who's name I know I've misspelt) - she organised a voucher to comp the breakfast as it what I'd originally booked for.  The room and food were fine, but it was the outstanding customer service that really made this trip memorable.

The outstanding feature of this hotel is the staff....Amazing service from everyone - especially Javier & his team of colleagues. Javier goes out of his way to personalise the guests experience ....always so friendly, authentic and helpful.

Stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 4 nights. Nice pool area and outdoor fireplaces where we enjoyed a glass of wine each evening. Restaurant/bar is great. The hotel manager, Janette was very accommodating and helpful with our requests. Clean & comfortable rooms.

A/C unit making lots of noise and they leave all the dishes in a middle of corridor and there is no one to even pick them up. At the bar they don't know even how to make any cocktail and we were waiting for our room to get ready for an hour after driving 8 hours to get there. Also the room was smelling cigarette and we had to change it again. I'm surprised how it says number 3.
Manager Response: Dear Mammy C,  Thank you for your recent visit to our property.  We are so very sorry to hear of the challenging experience you had during your visit.  The vital feedback provided is taken as a gift, and shall be passed along to our management staff as we strive to become better everyday.    Please feel free to contact me personally with any questions or concerns at 714 557 3000.  We hope your visit here does not discourage you from visiting one of our many IHG properties around the world.   Warm regards,  Aldo Casanova Guest Service Manager

Summary: We stayed here for 4 days. It was wonderful! The staff went out of their way to be sure that we had all that we wanted and needed. They treated us as honored guests and we felt at home immediately. I especially want to say thank you to Christian, Shane, Wailea, Guillermo, Carmela, Javier, Jeanet, Roxsana, and the General Manager Charles Haber. Also thank you for my excellent housekeeper for room 533. (I didn't get her name.) All of these people were genuinely interested in our well-being.  We had several meals at the hotel and everything was delicious and well-prepared. We used the pool and it was sparkling clean. My room was on the 5th floor and was spacious and very quiet.

Hotel is at a great location, right off the 405 freeway, next to McD and walkable distance to South Coast Plaza. Lobby is quaint, I like the lobby. You can buy snacks and refreshments at the lobby. Check-in was fast and friendly. Frontdesk personnel was utmost friendly and humorous too. Alleyway to the room was not lighted enough, there were some stains on the carpet. Room was big, including a living room (couch, table, coffee table), etc. I was able to do some yoga on the floor too (when move the coffee table to the side). It was a big enough space to invite 6 people over. We had trouble with our room key the first day, somehow the room keys did not work, and we had to go to the front desk to sort it out (happened twice). Bathroom was a good size, all standard amenities

Summary Heading: I'll stay here again if I'm in the area
Summary: I needed to stay in the area on the way from LA to San Diego.  Welcomed by the staff was great. They were very helpful and spotted I had a bag of Strawberries - offering to send up a fridge to the room. Nice touch.  The room was great, and as always with Crowne Plaza's in my experience the bed is big and fantastically comfortable.  The room had a great bathroom, with a nice big walk in shower. Perfect.  When I'm in the area I'll stay here again.

Summary Heading: A great place to stay - comfortable and affordable
Summary: Look, if you want a resort stay at a resort, but for a CLEAN nice room with a GREAT staff this is the best I've found in the area.  One big plus - no working girls in the bar or pool area.    Just a nice clean place to lay your head for the night.

Just a quick Uber or Taxi ride from the airport, or call complimentary hotel shuttle to come pick you up.  Not much to say about the hotel since we were only here for a couple of days passing through on our way to and from Puerto Vallarta, but the rooms are nice and the showers have the best water pressure of any I have ever experienced in California.

This is my sixth stay with the hotel and I have received platinum first class service from the front of the hotel to the back. The shuttle driver Dave is outstanding and friendly.  Roksana at the front desk is always smiling providing caring and friendly service to weary travelers.  Carmela, Ana  and Guerimo (?) delivered the best restaurant service and the food was always delicious.  Thank you!  Special thanks to Carmela!  You are the best!  David M.

Outdated and uninspiring architecture from the 70's.  Reminds me of the "old" Vegas.   I love dogs, but I would never bring 4 large-breed dogs into a hotel.  But this hotel allowed it.  Every time you would get inside the elevator is smelled like "dog".  One time I had to ride up with the cleaning carts (they share the same elevator) and it smelled like...damp musty towels and garbage.  The grounds are old, with no pathways.  The pool area is uninviting.  There was a large pile of dirt outside of my window next to the hot tub.  I have been to several 5-Star resorts (W in Bali, Kea Lani and several others) and I find it difficult, no impossible to believe that the Plaza is only 1 star less then a Starwood Resort.  This is a 3-star hotel, period.    The gym meets the minimum
Manager Response: Dear Joe P,  Thank you for the recent visit to our property.  We are very sorry to hear of the frustrations and challenges you faced during your stay.  Your vital feedback is important as we continue to strive to improve facility and services.   We look forward to hearing back from you so that we can ensure your next visit to one of our properties is a memorable one.  Please feel free to contact me directly at 714 557 3000.  Warm regards,  Aldo Casanova Crowne Plaza

Summary Heading: If this place is really 4 Stars, Star Ratings are officially useless!!!
Summary: This place is a monument to shabbiness.  The carpet is old and worn out.  The walls are covered in empty drill holes that never got patched after removing fixtures.  The pool towels are stained and frayed and compare unfavorably to my dish rags at home.  The carpet in the room had burn holes and the trim was all chipped and in need of fresh paint.  On the 5th floor every room has the room number sloppily handwritten in colored pencil across the patterned wall paper.  It looks ridiculous like renovating contractors wrote it in with the plan of removing it after the job was done but then forgot.    The staff was rude and curt.  When your hotel is as run down as this hole I would expect the staff to be extra nice and accommodating.  In fact the opposite is true.  I came expecting a
Manager Response: Dear Mike Michaels,   Thank you for your recent visit to our hotel.  We appreciate you taking the time to write your feedback, as it is critical to our success as we strive to improve our services and facilities. We are very sorry we fell short of your expectations, and also for any frustration you may have experienced.   Please know that your feedback is taken very seriously, and we will do what we can to address your concerns with our team.  It is our hopes that every guest that decides to stay with us receives exceptional service, and we will do our part to ensure this.  Feel free to reach me at 714 557 3000 with any further question or concern you may have.   Warm regards,   Aldo Casanova Guest Service Manager

Summary: I used to live in OC.  I've stayed at many hotels because I visit often as my parents are older.  The reason I say the Crown Plaza is the best because of central and convenient location (I was at the hotel within 15 minutes of landing and grabbing my car rental from National); newly renovated and comfortable rooms, great sound proofing between rooms and exterior, clean and spacious accommodations, great beds, and as have been said before, very kind, professional, and welcoming staff.  Excellent and complimentary wifi - even from the top floor.  Everyone at the front desk had great attitude and were helpful.  Staying in Room 529- a huge suite.  I've also stayed in 527 previously.  Incredibly silent for a near fully booked weekend.  Highly recommended and I will return.  They are

Summary Heading: Great service and Status Recognition Go a Long Way!
Summary: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza because it was conveniently located directly across the street from my conference.  Booking was easy and arrival was late as my flight was delayed.  I was not very friendly.  Fortunately the front desk staff was.  They immediately recognized and appreciated my Platinum status and upgraded my room along with comped me breakfast - which I need to address separately.   Anyway - my first room was on the ground level - it was nice, but the bar has a patio and there were many people from a wedding party out enjoying themselves.  I immediately went back to the desk and requested another room.  They were very apologetic and got me on the top level, another great room.  Very quiet and comfortable.  BREAKFAST!  WOW!  What a spread!!!  But I got down a few

Summary Heading: Fantastic Hotel. Best hotel of our 3 week holiday.
Summary: Modern and large rooms with Queen Beds. Many hotels only provide doubles. The restaurant and bar was fantastic with great value meals and a really good happy hour. The staff here are amazing and nothing is too much trouble. We rated this as the best hotel of our 3 week and 4 city family holiday. It was a great way to end our trip. Oh and the pool is fantastic and local shopping. I think you get it. You can not go wrong with this hotel. No complaints at all.

Summary Heading: Great staff and location for business in So Cal
Summary: I stayed here for 3 nights in early May for a business conference, the hotel is on the smaller side when it comes to their conference rooms etc...but, we only had 40 people so it worked for us.  The staff was all very accommodating from front desk, restaurant and bar to the maids.  I would recommend this hotel to business travelers and people who have things to do in this area....which is not a big touristy place.

I stayed at the Crown Plaza with my mom and aunt.  As an IHG Employee, I felt as though I was treated as normal guest.  Michael at the front desk was very friendly and accommodating.  I am very thankful for his hospitality towards me and my family.  My mom had some cocktails at the restaurant and loved them!  When there was a problem with our TV, engineering came right away to fix it. The shuttle was soooooo convenience to go nearly everywhere you need to go. South Coast Plaza is RIGHT NEXT DOOR!  (bad for my wallet lol).  The little things go along way.  From one IHG employee to another, I appreciate it a lot.  Thanks Crown Plaza Costa Mesa

This Hotel was very enjoyable to stay.  We had some challenges in the Beggining of our stay but Stephan and Aldo took care of us and made the trip fun and very accomodating for us as we attending the 86th Far Western Regional Conference of Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Incorporated.  Thank you for your hospitality and great customer service.

The hotel has everything a nice 4-star hotel needs to offer. The receptionists were very friendly and helpful when we checked in. The hotel room was bright, clean and newly renovated. The complimentary buffet breakfast offers plenty of choices. I particularly like the variety of its fruits bar. Totally refreshing!  The room rate was very reasonable too. I will definitely come back if I get to visit Irvine once again!

From the hotel driver Greg to the front desk staff, the entire hotel is a pleasure to stay at. I come here about 4 times a year and only find the hotel and staff to continue to improve. The rooms are nice and the restaurant is very good as well. I love staying here and feel very well taken care of every time.

It doesn't look like much from the outside but the inside is modern and clean.  Room was very quiet (5th floor overlooking pool).  Bed comfortable.  Nice bathroom with separate toilet and big shower.  Used the pool area for reading.  Quiet and comfortable lounge chairs.  We only had one garbage can in our room, which was a bit difficult.  I like having a separate can for recycling.  Also, no pad or paper for writing notes.  I would definitely stay here again.  Price was reasonable.

This hotel was easily to find, centrally located and beautiful.  Fully equipped with everything you would need.  Nice buffet.  Great bed and pillows.  Large room and 10 minutes from Balboa Island and Fashion Island.  Had a great time.

Summary Heading: Stay away from rooms on the first floor!
Summary: I will preface this review by stating that, as a longtime Platinum IHG member, I am incredulous at getting the worst room in the hotel...room 136...close to the elevator, right across from the fitness center and along the sidewalk right outside the window.  Sometimes you learn more about how a hotel is run by having a mediocre room. The traffic noise on the west wing of the hotel and on the first floor begins its rumblings at around 5:20am. This was one half hour after I was awoken by an energetic sort that loudly entered the fitness center across the hall.  The room is perfunctory as it was an old Holiday Inn room years ago before their transformation. The sink gurgles on the first floor as though water is close to sprouting forth and the shower does not drain normally.  The
Manager Response: Dear Markcap,  Obviously we let you down and we cannot be more apologetic. Feedback is truly a gift in our culture and your observations have been shared with the entire hotel staff.   Additional emphasis has already been placed on preventative maintenance, pre-check in inspection and room assignments.   I thank you for the kind words with the General Manager and will be anxious to welcome you back to our hotel.  Warm regards,  Aldo Casanova  Guest Service Manager 714 557 3000

Summary: I have stayed at this facility several times over the past few years, and lately, they have really stepped up the customer service!  As a new IHG member and convert from the Hilton chain, I was welcomed and treated to some nice amenities. Mostly just being paid attention to was a happy change from 'the other guys'  Anytime there is an issue the staff is very quick and happy to resolve it. The rooms are clean and quiet.    The in-house restaurant has some great choices, and there are other options within a short walk.

We stayed at this hotel as wedding guest over the weekends.  The rooms were decent, but AC loud.  There's free shuttle to South Coast Plaza but get filled up quickly.  We came back from a wedding at 11p and the lobby bar was closed.  Not sure what hotel closes their bar at 11p on a Saturday especially when we were told it will close at 1a when we checked in.
Manager Response: Dear Jnlv2trvl,  Thank you for your recent stay at our property.  Glad to know you enjoyed the room accommodations however we are sad to hear of the challenges you faced with our bar.  We have since reached to your group leader.  Your feedback is appreciated and will be utilized as a training opportunity moving forward.   We hope that we can welcome you back if you ever find yourself in the area once again.  Please feel free to contact me with any questions.  Warm regards,  Aldo Casanova Guest Service Manager   Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa Orange County 3131 Bristol Street Costa Mesa, CA 92626 D  714 557-3000 F   714 957 8957

Summary: The hotel is nice - its located next to the world famous South Coast Plaza, but what sets this place apart from nearly every other hotel I have stayed at is the staff. I dont know what the management here do for staff training - but keep doing it. They greet you like long lost friends and nothing is too much trouble. I stay at way more hotels than I care to think about but the staff here take the cake. I have stayed at several 6 star hotels but the friendliness often seems manufactured - at the Crowne Plaza it really seems sincere - well done guys - I look forward to every return trip I have.

A clear example of customer excellence, which is driven from the top down. Consistantly welcomed, every staff member genuienly appreciates you being there and nothing is a problem. Clean great facilities, great shuttle service, nice food and bar (with fire pit). The amazing part is, now I know I come here every month or 2, but being acknowledged by your name from the front desk staff, well that is just amazing. You guys rock!

Stayed here for 4 days in a recent business trip. The hotel is nice and is near some good bars and restaurants. There is a bar in the Lobby that was usually busy but there's better places down the street. Room was big and spacious hotel staff was very courteous. There is a parking issue in the lot. Be aware.

Another couple stayed with us while in California Saturday evening. Although this place is located in a prime spot between restaurants/shopping and freeways, I was slightly disappointed by the quality of the rooms after looking at so many pictures online. The room was dark with not much lighting and very minimal outlet plugs. Our air conditioner was very noisy and the bathroom was pretty small.   I can tell there have been some updates to the hotel and the lobby area is very pretty but I feel the rooms themselves are lacking somewhat for the price.
Manager Response: Dear Kate W,  Thank you for your recent visit to our property.  We do apologize as our rooms did not meet your satisfaction.  It would be our pleasure to welcome you back to our hotel if you find yourself in the area once again.  Feel free to reach out to me with any other questions or conerns.  Warm regards,  Aldo Casanova Assistant Front Desk Manager 714 557 3000

Summary Heading: Gotta think real hard to find any faults
Summary: I spent two nights at this hotel over Valentine's Day weekend, using points I had earned through IHG.  Check in took a bit longer than I would have liked, but otherwise the staff was polite and helpful.  In fact, instead of the routine choices of courtesy treats given to me at check in, I asked for complimentary parking and the young man obliged.  Other than a small stain on a chair, the room was pristine.  The bed and bathroom were awesome.  The location is unbeatable.  I asked for a room away from the freeway/street, and I did not hear any noise.  My only complaint would have to be that the toilet is awfully loud.  I actually jumped the first time I flushed because I was startled!  At night, I could hear the toilet flushing from the room next door.

After spending a lot of time over the last year in Costa Mesa, I always feel so happy when I know I'm booked into the Crowne Plaza rather than the Hilton across the road. Why you ask? Well here it is. The staff are absolutely amazing. They are so friendly and nothing is too much trouble for them. They are extremely attentive and welcome me back by name every time I get there. When you spend so much time away from home it's nice to know you're welcomed by familiar faces. I can't praise them enough. They could definitely show the staff across the road at the Hilton how it should be done. The beds are great and I always get a fantastic nights sleep followed by room service breakfast which is always hot and tasty with prompt service. The bar and outdoor patio area is a nice area to

The hotel seemed newly renovated, which is great. The rooms were spacious and very reasonably priced. I stayed in a queen double room. Though the view is of the street below, there was very limited noise coming from outside and it was pleasant enough.   The hotel is just a few minutes away from South coast Plaza mall, making it very convenient.   Overall have nothing bad to say about the hotel, and would most definitely recommend to anyone.

Great staff friendly helpful and nothing is too much trouble. Lovely rooms great beds, love the State of the art Crowne Plaza clip to block out the california sun when you are trying to sleep. It has a great pool area pleasant bar and reasonably priced restaurant.If I was to be really picky I would ask for a softer pillow. Gym is being upgraded and this will make it perfect. It has a great Les Mills in room Exercise programme on TV. I am always happy to come back and stay here.Rubin L.

Lovely comfortable quiet rooms and such friendly staff. Pool area is very nice gets sun most of the day. Decent sized pool. Room service is great the salads especially. I stay here very often and cannot fault the staff.

The Hotel ist located just next to a Highway. If the room is facing the traffic it can be sometimes loud. The rooms are well equipped and spaceous. The gym has a good size, whereas if there is broken Equipment, it should be fixed as quickly as possible. The Restaurant/bar has quiet a good choice and Quality of Food and beverages. A perfect Hotel for a Business stay.

Stayed at this hotel for a business meeting last week and had a great stay. The staff went above and beyond to make everyone comfortable as it appeared to be a busy week for them.  Keith, Ashley and Maria were 3 individuals that really stuck out. Keep up the great work!

It will be hard to find a more friendly staff in Southern California. Nothing is too difficult, nothing seems to be an issue. You ask you shall receive. Just  brilliant. Nice renovated rooms, bathrooms and fantastic staff. Free internet and great concierge.

Our family stayed for 8 nights here recently after recommendations from colleagues.  We certainly weren't disappointed - the rooms were really spacious and clean with comfortable (queen) beds and pillows. In the bathroom there was the best shower I've ever seen in a hotel - it had two shower heads - one a "Monsoon" type and another ordinary one.  The restaurant is very reasonable with delicious food.  All through the hotel we encountered friendly, accommodating staff.    I would highly recommend this place.  Even though it's quite a ways South, there is plenty to do around the area.  Example, the South Coast Plaza is one of the largest in the world and about 10 mins walk away.  A couple of blocks down Bristol Street there is a lovely area called "Camp" which has a great array of

The capable staff at Crowne Plaza in Costa Mesa helped to make my recent stay a personal and professional success!  I was visiting the hotel for a rigorous training/testing meeting and worked very hard while I was there. The staff always met me with kindness and care whenever I was able to take a break. They actually took time to ask how I was coming along with my work each time we passed in the lobby or hallway and during every meal I ate at the Fireside Tavern. I was there for four nights and did not leave the property for any reason. I didn't need to!  The staff used my name when speaking with me, which made me feel special. Please share my gratitude with Michael at the front desk and Christian (and company) in your restaurant. Let them know that I passed my test with flying

Absolutely lovely hotel and staff.   Close to mall/shops and very safe area.  Gym not so great but have access to local gym.  Free shuttle service everywhere.   Very nice rooms, very contemporary feel.  Lots of people stay here.  Highly recommend

The rooms and beds are comfortable. The pool, spa and exercise room are very attractive. The breakfast buffet is very good. Staff are friendly and helpful and it's easy to get to, from several freeways. We stay there every year and will continue. My only criticism is the cabinet with the safe, closet and coffee machine is awkward. You have to take the whole coffee tray and put it in the bathroom where the cord runs across the sink or you put it on the desk and then there's no place for your computer. It's a small thing to complain about  but adding a small table would be so easy!

Summary Heading: Don't stay here if you have a discounted rate.  Actually,  just don't stay here unless you want to be treated like crap
Summary: Stayed here because training was here.  Tried to check in at 5:30, but told no rooms available.   Apparently,  guests either checked out late our overstayed their reservation because the storm back east.  Not offered any accommodation, other than a free drink (I don't drink).  When I heard others were getting rooms, I went to check on mind but it still wasn't ready.  I was told the others were booked at a different rate.  But if there truly were not rooms,  what difference does the rate make?  When roombwas ready an hour later, I was told I wouldn't be charged for any food ordered in the bar.  It would have been nice to know that ahead of time so I could have ordered dinner.
Manager Response: Dear Avidtraveler19,  Thank you very much for your recent visit to our property.  We apologize for the challenges you faced during your check in process.  Our goal is to have everyone checked into the hotel in a timely manner and unfortunately this was not the case.  Your vital feedback will be utilized as a training opportunity for our staff.   We look forward to welcoming you back to our hotel should you ever find yourself in the area once again.   Warm regards,   Aldo Casanova Sales & Social Media Administrator Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa Orange County   3131 Bristol Street Costa Mesa, CA 92626 D  714 557-3000 F   714 957 8957

Summary: Michael was so helpful at booking that I felt compelled to thank him personally when I checked in. I travel often and seldom experience the professionalism and work ethic that he displayed. My stay was comfortable and I was pleasantly surprised by the level of customer service from the front desk to housekeeping. This hotel is definitely on my return to list.

The Hotel staff was wonderful!  The Hotel was clean and the beds were very comfortable.  The location is close to the airport and the Hotel povides a shuttle service.  They were great about dropping off and picking up at the mall and restaurants.  The beach is close, although we did not have time to enjoy it, I hear it is fantastic.

The location of this hotel in ideal in Orange County and it's almost in the heart of Southern California. It's close to John Wayne Airport and sits at the one corner of the 405 and 55 freeways. This is my third stay at this hotel and aside from the location, I liked the fact that there is plenty of parking outside the building and the lobby is kinda quite, you can easily walk in and out of the hotel without too much hoopla. Also, they have a choice of showers, bathtub or a walk-in shower, the default is the tub it seems but you can ask for a walk-in.   However, with my third visit I realized that the quality of the service in going down. In my second visit I noticed that one towel was dirty, the next day the pillow cover didn't look clean. I thought maybe this is just a one off
Manager Response: Dear TheTravelSheriff,  We thank you for your recent visit to our property.  Your feedback is greatly appreciated.  We are very happy to hear that you have enjoyed the great central location our hotel offers.  At the same time we are very saddened to hear that your past two stays have not been up to your standards or ours.    Please accept our apologies for the challenges you have faced and know we are currently investigating the situation with our housekeeping management team.  We would very much like to welcome you back to the hotel if you find yourself in the area once again.  My direct number should you need to reach me is 714 913 9058.  Warm regards,  Aldo Casanova Sales & Social Media Administrator Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa Orange County   3131 Bristol Street Costa Mesa, CA 92626 D  714 557-3000 F   714 957 8957

Summary: My son and I were made very welcome when we arrived. The rooms were clean, tidy and spacious. There was a free shuttle within 5 miles of the hotel. This was great for transfer from the airport and also to Costa Mesa Plaza. Michael was very helpful. Went out of his way to help. I would definitely stay here on another visit.

When travelling for business, sometimes arriving late at the hotel, it's nice to find a comfortable restaurant open late, even offering a late-night "happy hour" with specials created by an in-house chef. The pool, free shuttle, and comfortable nicely-designed rooms make this a great place to stay when visiting Orange County.

We were at the CP OC for 10 days while visiting family and friends. The room was spacious, comfortable and clean. The staff was outstanding. The only downside was the buffet breakfast was pretty average. We wouldn't hesitate to stay at the CP OC again on our next visit.

The rooms were tidy and well furnished for the price. Furthermore, the hotel staff, and level of customer service was excellent. Michael was particularly helpful.  The location is ideal, and complementary hotel shuttle services were great.

Great hotel near South Coast plaza for the shoppers and close to 405 for other adventures. Friendly helpful staff... Fab pool area for lounging after a hard days shopping or having a little exercise to burn off Californias famous mexican food

This hotel is a hidden gem very deceiving from the outside.  Perfect location just adjacent to South Coast Plaza shopping mall.  The rooms are modern and very well equipped.  This is a far better option than the Hilton across the road.  Of particular note is the efficiency and helpfulness of the staff.  Michael  Samuel  and Javier you are a credit. Thank you so much for a great stay.

As long as I work for my current company and need a hotel in OC, I'm staying here.  I've stayed here for 6 months this year due to a work assignment.  Staff: I have to start off by saying the people that work here are the best.  They're both professional and personable.  Everyone from the shuttle driver to the front desk people and room service are great (Giovanna, Sam, Javier, Omar, Greg, Lance, Elizabeth, Alex, Stephan, Chris, etc).  They always do their best and they will fix it if they make a mistake.  They accommodate to everybody's requests even beyond other hotels' rules.  Please don't try to take advantage of them - I've seen people be completely unreasonable to these guys.  Just be nice to them and they'll try to take care of you and your odd requests.  Rooms: Interiors

Staff are so pleasant and made our stay - nothing was too hard for them. Great location - walking distance to shops and restaurants. Food in the restaurant Fireside was beautiful as well. Loved my stay.

Summary Heading: Fantastic value and super friendly staff
Summary: from the moment we arrived till we checked out we were given an exceptional experience. The rooms were fresh and clean. Check in was extremely efficient and the knowledge of the staff in regards to attractions and how to get around was fantastic. The hotel is in a great location to the Costa Mesa shopping areas and is adjacent to the freeway. Upon check out the service continued when our special request was welcomed and met. Terrific hotel and exceptional staff!!!!!

We had a nice comfortable room - enjoyed the extras like Kurig coffee and swivel TV.  Jacuzzi was great - although it would have been great if we could have located the light in it.  Staff was very helpful and accommodating.  Good location.  Would stay again!

I have been very impressed with this hotel. I needed a hotel that is close to UCI and UCI Medical Center, and chose to stay here. The location is amazing, with South Coast Plaza and other great shops and restaurants nearby.  What really sets this hotel apart from others is the great staff. At the front desk, Sam has always been kind, helpful, and professional. Alex and Michael are also very friendly and eager to provide great service. Giovanna and Brenda are very sweet and would ask me about my day when I saw them in the lobby. I can't say enough nice things about the people who work here. The rooms and beds are clean and comfortable. There's also free wi-fi internet, and the hotel bar serves good food and drinks. If you are traveling to Orange County, this is the hotel to stay

Had an issue with my A/C unit, so after a miserable night, changed rooms the next day.  They offered nothing....nothing for the hassle and inconvienence I experienced.  Also no bottled water or to go coffee cups in the room. Cudo's to Greg the shuttle driver!  He was Excellent.
Manager Response: Dear Dougdjy,  Thank you very much for your recent stay and vital feedback provided.  We are very sorry to hear of the difficulties you faced with the air conditioning unit and lack of service by our front desk.  We have since communicated this information to our front desk management staff and will use this feedback as a training opportunity.  It‚Äôs very nice to hear Greg left a positive impression with you, as that is the service we strive to have.  Please contact me if you ever find yourself in the Orange County area as we would like to welcome you back to a better service experience.    Warm regards,   Aldo Casanova Sales & Social Media Administrator Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa Orange County   3131 Bristol Street Costa Mesa, CA 92626 D  714 557-3000 F   714 957 8957

Summary Heading: Stay for food, not shuttle. Feather alert!
Summary: I stayed in Crowne Plaza because I had 3 days of appointments at a nearby clinic. This clinic said that the Crowne Plaza offered a shuttle service to their clinic. I called the front desk of this Crowne Plaza to inquire about the shuttle service. They told me just to request the times I needed the shuttle when I checked in. So when I checked in I requested a shuttle for a 12 p.m. appointment the next day. The front desk pulled out their shuttle request sheet and told me that the nearest shuttle opening was for 8 a.m. And so it went for all 3 days. They also gave me the name of the shuttle driver to call when my appointment was completed. On all three days I had to wait about an hour for the return trip on the shuttle. And the real quandary for me was that the hotel was so close
Manager Response: Dear Qualgal,  Thank you for your recent stay with us and bringing these matters to our attention.¬† Our sincere apologies due to the challenges you faced during your stay.¬† Our shuttle service does run based upon availability so that we can accommodate everyone in the hotel in a timely manner.¬† Our hotel does offer alternatives to down pillows and comforters, as there were no special requests made on the reservation we were unable to arrange this request before your arrival.¬† We would definitely appreciate the opportunity to ensure your next stay is an enjoyable one.¬† Please feel free to contact me directly to book your room and any special needs.   Warm regards,  Aldo Casanova Sales &¬†Social Media¬†Administrator Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa Orange County   3131 Bristol Street Costa Mesa, CA 92626 D¬† 714 557-3000 F¬†¬†¬†714 957 8957

Summary Heading: So so hotel in the OC
Summary: The check in staff was more interested in telling me about his Tri Athlete work than checking me in correctly.  Did not get my IHF number in the system the first time.  The elevator stunk terribly of a sour milk fiasco on the 3d floor.  After I got out of the shower, I noticed long hairs that weren't mine.  I am an almost bald male.  Totally gross.  The bar only had 3 taps live out of 8 available.  Sad.  The food in the restaurant was good I will say.  People I was with enjoyed it as well.   This place needs a good scrub.  It was a Holiday Inn once and now it was "upgraded".  It wants to be a W or a Sofitel, but can't make the grade.  Stephane is a nice manager that is willing to help, but I don't know if he has any power.  Please work on your housekeeping.
Manager Response: Dear Treehouse_man,  Thank you for your recent visit to our property and the vital feedback provided.  We are very disappointed to hear of the challenges you faced during your stay.  We have since used your review as a vital training opportunity for our front desk, housekeeping and restaurant.  However, we were glad to hear that you enjoyed your meal and your interaction with Stephane.  He is a vital asset to our company and we value his input.    We hope that we can welcome you back to Crowne Plaza in Costa Mesa on your next trip to Orange County.  Please reach out to me personally if you should need any assistance in booking your reservation.   Warm regards,  Aldo Casanova Sales & Social Media Administrator Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa

Summary: The staff were all very friendly! The bed was very comfortable.  The sheets were nice and crisp yet soft. The restaurant food had a good variety for breakfast. The people were there to serve and make you comfortable. We'd like to go back some day.

Clean room, very comfortable bed, quiet, great location, very friendly, helpful staff-what is not to like?  We spent two nights during a quick trip to SoCal and the location was very convenient for moving around in Orange County.  The South Coast Mall might have been too close (...I don't want to see the visa bill for that visit) but we found great restaurants and other diversions within 15 minutes in any direction.  I would definitely stay again.

I booked this hotel based on the reviews. I was especially impressed by how friendly and accommodating the staff was when I called to ask regarding details of the room we were getting. Lance at the front desk was very helpful, friendly and informative. He made sure that the room was exactly how I wanted it and made sure that I had everything I needed for my stay. He is definitely an asset to the company. Upon check in, we were greeted with a big smile by Giovanna at the front desk. The check-in was a breeze and she even made arrangements for us to be shuttled to Seasons 52 for our dinner that night. After we got done getting ready in our room, we headed downstairs to the lobby to find Omar, our shuttle driver, waiting for us. The whole entire staff was exceptional! The Crown

Hotel Location: within 15mins walking distance to South Coast Plaza shopping centre, with many retail and beauty stores, grocers, restaurants etc. Easy public transport or driving distance to Newport and Laguna Beaches.  Hotel and Rooms: great sized, clean rooms, nicely furnished with modern decor and good lighting. Beautiful bathroom with hurricane shower and seperate toilet. Beautiful pool area.  Staff: Wonderful staff, really friendly, helpful and accommodating.   Restaurant and Bar: Great happy hour menu, nice restaurant with typical menu.

We booked this hotel based on the reviews.  For approx $100/night I thought it was a good deal.  When we drove up, I started to wonder if we had made a mistake.  The hotel is very old.  It looks like a hotel from the 70s.  The elevator was old and the permit had expired in July (we visited in Nov).  The wallpaper in the hallways looked very old as well.  The door to our room stuck somewhat when we opened it.    The lobby had been updated.  The staff was all dressed in suits and extremely nice and helpful.  However, the atmosphere gave the feel that the hotel was trying to be something it was not.  Our room had been updated.  The beds were nice, the bathroom had basic toiletries and upgraded shower head.  There was a safe and Keurig coffee maker in the room as well.    If you are
Manager Response: Dear kay2003cat,  We appreciate your visit to our hotel.  We are very sorry we fell short of your expectations when it came to the property.  The information provided will be passed along to our management and ownership team.  If you ever find yourself in Orange County once again please reach out to us if you need any assitance in booking your room.   Warm regards,  Aldo Casanova Sales and Social Media Administrator

Summary: I attended a conference here last week and I was pleasantly surprised!  This property has recently completed a major renovation, tastefully done.  Food was excellent, great service and professional staff all around.

We had been to Costa Mesa before but not since 2005. As we drove up to what we thought was the Crowne Plaza we were surprised to see it was a Westin. We found out that the Westin had taken that space and that the Crowne Plaza had moved down the street. As we spoke to locals they were all confused as well. We enjoyed our stay at the new Crowne Plaza. The room had a comfortable bed, couch instead of a chair and was clean We appreciated the reasonable rate.
Manager Response: Dear DiningDetectives,  Thank you so much for your recent trip to our hotel.  We do apologize for the confusion in locating the property.  The previous Crowne Plaza had been located in Irvine, where the Wyndham now exists.  We are very glad you enjoyed the accommodations and hope that we can host you soon once again.  Please feel free to contact me if you need any assistance in doing so.   Warm regards,  Aldo Casanova Sales & Social Media Administrator Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa Orange County   3131 Bristol Street Costa Mesa, CA 92626 D  714 557-3000 F   714 957 8957

Summary: This hotel is about an hour from LA Intl airport. Close to expensive shopping mall but great shops around the mall. Everything is a little spread out so wear good walking shoes.  There is an area called The Lab and across the road The Camp great restaurants and bars about 10 min walk from hotel. The only thing wrong with this hotel is the air conditioning units are very big and noisy, small gym, nice pool area.
Manager Response: Dear Winnie S,  Thank you for your recent visit to our property.  We are very happy you have enjoyed the local area and attractions near by the hotel.  We do apologize for the challenge you faced with our air conditioning unit.  We have since had our maintenance engineer resolve the issue.  We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel soon.  Warm regards,   Aldo Casanova Sales & Social Media Administrator Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa Orange County   3131 Bristol Street Costa Mesa, CA 92626 D  714 557-3000 F   714 957 8957

Summary: Again staff!!  amazing staff   The room upgraded to executive which was very nice and gave me and my lady plenty of room. I'm huge on bathrooms and this was clean with good pressure and nice shower  The hotel is in a great location literally right off the major 405 highway.   I love IHG and I also had breakfast included in my rate which was nice and really good with nice waiting staff at the restaurant that were very polite  I'll stay here again for the comfortable room and the absolutely great welcoming staff that makes you feel welcomed and want to come back.

Business trip and booked two rooms/two nights. Had a problem with one room, had to move and got a refund with no problem. Staff was courteous, helpful and very friendly. The environment was warm and welcoming.

I was only staying for one night and I often need to stay in hotels in the Orange County.  Is it close to the airport?  Yes.  Is it close to Newport Beach, South Coast Plaza and Disneyland?  Yes. The room looked to have been remodeled with the furniture looking chic, but basic.  When you look closely the room is dirty in the corners.  The bed looks inviting.   I stayed on the 3rd floor facing the Main Street. What made the experience horrible: 1). It was 90 degrees + the week of October 6th.  The room was extremely hot when I checked in.  I saw the swamp cooler by the window and thought "noooooo". It will take forever to cool down.  Then I saw a digital thermostat on the wall.  It only had a cool/heat and low/high with the temp you can lower to 65 degrees.  At first it cooled
Manager Response: Dear JDCNECSCV,  Thank you for your recent stay.  We are happy to hear that the hotel is conveniently located near points of interest for you, however disappointed to know your expectations were not met.  We do apologize for the challenges you faced while staying at our property.  We have since had the air conditioning unit checked and a quality check done with our housekeeping team.  Should your travels bring you back to Orange County feel free to reach out to me personally, so that we may ensure your next stay be an enjoyable time.   Warm regards,  Aldo Casanova Sales & Social Media Administrator Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa Orange County   3131 Bristol Street Costa Mesa, CA 92626 D  714 557-3000 F   714 957 8957

Summary: First - hotel far exceeded my expectations in terms of quality of room and location. Second - Elizabeth went above and beyond my expectations on customer service, by locating a binder I had left behind, falling up directly with me such that I was able retrieve it before leaving traveling back to CT.  It was greatly appreciated!  - Mike M

There were a few problems with our stay, however- they were resolved to our satisfaction. And because of that- there really is no use in reiterating because quite frankly, if a hotel can do a great job in recovering- then kudos to them.  The pros of the hotel:  - GREAT location - modern rooms that were clean - good housekeeping service (traveler tip: wherever you go, don't leave too much of a mess anyway) - polite front desk agents - easy parking   Will definitely stay again and again.

The hotel is very close to airport and South Coast Plaza, also close to Japanese supermarket Mitzuwa. The hotel is just 3 stories, although it was an old building, inside is clean and looks pretty new.

We visited Costa Mesa because we were there because we were seeking treatment at the Amen Clinic.I checked out reviews on Trip Advisor and it was a tough decision between the Hilton and The Crown Plaza.Both had good reviews.Also both had discounts if you were being treated at Amen Clinic.We ended staying at The Crown Plaza for three nights.We were very happy with our stay. We asked for a quiet room.We had two rooms on the second floor  they were very quiet,the rooms are very sound proof.The only part about the room that was ok was the air conditioning unit they do not have central air each room has its own unit in room.But it was fine because everything else was so good.  Housekeeping staff was very good. The hotel staff were great very professial.We had room service the food

The staff at this hotel are fantastic...really friendly,welcoming & accommodating...the rooms are lovely,though somewhat small as I believe they have renovated & made the bathroom bigger which took away the wardrobe...now there is a freestanding wardrobe in the room which feels too big for the space...however if it is only for a single or couple it's fine..I wouldn't recommend for families to share a room....the rooms with even numbers are on the road side are not as sunny as the ones on the pool side (odd numbers)...the pool area is lovely with plenty of loungers & tables/umbrellas & even a nice grassy area.  I ate at the hotel restaurant several times too as it was very reasonably priced & had a great happy hour ($8 a burger!)....will definitely return....

Summary Heading: My new favorite place to stay
Summary: I travel to Costa Mesa a lot for work and usually stay at the Hilton, although I have stayed at nearly every property around South Coast Plaza including the Wyndham, Westin, Courtyard, Marriott.  Booking through my corporate site though, this hotel came up with an incredible rate and I had to keep double checking the location because I couldn't believe how close it was, that I had never stayed there before and how good the rate was.  There must be something wrong with I thought but I'll try it.  It was great!  The room was very nice and the whole property looked recently updated.  The location was great with easy access in and out, with a convenient stoplight to aid getting onto busy Bristol and the 405.  Since it was a business trip, I didn't use much of the facility besides my

Great hotel. Rooms are good to american standards.  Value for money. We had a very good deal which included breakfast and free wifi. The breakfast is excellent. Very friendly and helpful staff. Hotel is very close to the South Coast Plaza Shopping mall and approx. 10 miles from the beach.

I had to travel to Orange County on business before moving to the area. I chose the Crowne Plaza because of a great rate that was offered over the Labor Day holiday weekend.  After changing rooms due to a gas smell in my first room, the stay went pretty good.  Rooms are of a decent size, with large beds, a desk, cushioned arm chair and ottoman and a bench at the foot of the bed.  The bathroom was also a good size with a walk in shower.  The separate toilet and the vanity area have sliding doors that do not lock.    A two-door closet unit is very dark, and holds the Keurig coffee machine.  No microwave or refrigerator inside the room was a bummer.  Although I did see some refrigerators outside a couple of rooms, so I guess you can request one for an extra charge.    The A/C unit

Summary Heading: Handy to everything in the area
Summary: Spent a few nights at this Crowne Plaza property and choose it as it was part of the IHG and close to the US Swimming championships in Irvine. Found my room comfortable (air-con was a bit noisy) and the facilities more than adequate. Staff work helpful at the front desk and very friendly at the bar for late evening happy hour(s) (10-12) just what you need when travelling alone! It has a nice pool as well large enough for some laps on the downside the breakfast buffet was not expensive but not to the standard of other Crowne Plaza properties I've stayed.

Clean, comfortable, nicely decorated room. Comfy bed. Decent size bathroom & walk in shower. Only negative was the crappy lighting for putting on makeup.Would have liked to have a little refrigerator in the room. Great breakfast buffet. Conveniently located close to the freeway and the beaches. Will definitely consider staying again.

Summary Heading: Tremendous customer service and great breakfast
Summary: My family recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa while our daughter attended a concert close by.  The service was excellent.  Javier at the front desk was extremely helpful and gave us all the information we needed about the surrounding area.  The shuttle to and from the Mall situated close by was very helpful.  The room was great, had everything we needed and very comfortable as we were upgraded to a King executive.  I travel extensively for business and I was very impressed with the restaurant.  The breakfast offerings were outstanding and the coffee was great.

We stayed at the Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa because we went to the Orange County Fair to see the band Little Big Town.  Our stay could not have been better!  We stayed for two nights.  The hotel is clean and comfortable.  It was very easy to find, just off the freeway.  Our room was large and comfortable.  The beds are amazing! So comfortable.  We ate dinner one night and breakfast on morning at the hotel restaurant.  The food and service was way beyond what I would expect for a hotel restaurant.  The employees really make this hotel special.  They do a great job, providing excellent customer service.  An example:  I asked a gentleman at the front desk to call me a cab.  He politely asked where I would like to go.  When I told him it was the fairgrounds, he asked if I knew about

Room nicely decorated but would have been nice to have fridge as in cheaper hotels such as Holiday Inn. Pool area is great, large heated pool and children had it all to themselves and hot tub. Surprised that smoking is allowed by the pool. Overall a very good hotel with helpful staff.

Summary Heading: Good room but that is it
Summary: Needed to stay around Northern Irvine and selected the Crowne Plaza because I am a Gold Ambassador with IHG.  The hotel's location is convenient by the 405 freeway. There is a nearby mall and some fast food places too. But Costa Mesa is far from being a holiday destination.  The hotel's exterior looks quite nice but the Hilton across the street has the upper edge when it comes to appearance. I arrived well after midnight and the check in was fast but I I did not get the usual "we thank you for being a loyal ambassador" nor did I get an upgrade. That is partially because the hotel has one class of rooms. I was given the choice of two drinks or 400 bonus points at the reception, but that was it.  Went up to the room and it was very large and recently rennovated. Missing was the
Manager Response: Dear Maher A.,  We appreciate your comments regarding the oversight of your Gold status (applicable to Intercontinental Hotels) from our front office.  We will use your experience as part of our on going training to ensure all guests are greeted with a warm welcome.  Should your travels bring you back to Costa Mesa please reach out to me before booking your stay at the Crowne Plaza.  Warm regards, Aldo Casanova Sales & Social Media Administrator Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa Orange County   3131 Bristol Street Costa Mesa, CA 92626 D  714 557-3000 F   714 957 8957

Summary: Stayed here over the July 4th weekend.  Based on earlier reviews the hotel was recently renovated and it looked great.  We had a first floor room.  At some hotels we have stayed at, having lower floors can lead to more noise, but not here.  We didn't have any issues with that.  Easy access to the freeways was handy, although one of the main reasons I picked this location.  The hotel staff was very friendly.  We weren't able to use the pool or eat at the restaurant onsite, but both looked good.

Summary Heading: Nice rooms, handy to interstates, attentive staff and great food.
Summary: Want to commend Andrew on his service in the bar/restaurant. Particularly on Sat night when it was crowded, our service was fabulous. When some of the customers with a large group were difficult, he kept his cool and looked after all of the patrons. Also kudos to the chefs. Great food always.

I coordinated a high school class reunion at the Crowne Plaza  Costa Mesa for a group of approximately 50 persons.  Crowne Plaza Captain, Mr. Oscar Guzman,made our event the best ever!  Oscar is attentive, courteous, helpful and there when you need him. He is experienced in all facets of managing an event seamlessly serving our group efficiently and going the extra mile to address individual requests such as providing carafes of ice tea at the coffee table. We really enjoyed working with Mr. Guzman and recommend him highly.

Unlike the surrounding hotels that cater to tourists and kids, this hotel is primarily a business hotel which means it is quiet, efficient, and straightforward.  No extra "resort" fees for parking, wifi, etc.  The hotel restaurant is quite good with actual cooked food, not microwaved frozen stuff. We had a room that faced Bristol and were concerned about noise but overall it was acceptably quiet.   We will be returning.

Stayed here for 4 nights while visiting family.  Location is very convenient to John Wayne airport, South Coast Plaza shopping and other locations...The room, although just a bit small was clean, comfortable bed and quiet.  The staff was friendly and we enjoyed the breakfast options of buffet or choice from the menu as part of our room package.  We did not have to pay for parking because we were always able to find a spot on the front side of the hotel open parking lot.  The hotel also included free wifi.  We will stay at this hotel on return trips to the area.

....Is all I can say for this particular visit. I've stayed her on a few occassions when i visit for business.  Rooms are great, clean and the lobby is finally done and looks awesome. Rooms can be a bit small, but very well put together.  Beds are comfy and i absolutely love the rain shower heads.    The gym is not too bad, restaurant is good enough to eat in and you can find quite a few restaurants in the area; plus the mall.  There is a neighborhood right behind the hotel and the night crowds at the gas stations in the area can be a bit shady.  I like to run when I travel, but not feeling all that safe running any where around this area.    Two misses on this trip 1) as a rewards member I was given the cold shoulder for booking on a prepay business website.  Like really???  I

Summary Heading: Impeccable Service at the Crowne Plaza Hotel
Summary: I recently spent three days at the Crowne Plaza Hotel, during a staycation of sorts. The hotel grounds were very well maintained. I found my hotel room to be comfortable. The food at the on-site restaurant was delicious. Most of all, I was impressed with the hotel staff. The staff members I encountered were all incredibly polite, accommodating and eager to ensure that I had a pleasant stay at the hotel. I would definitely stay at this Crowne Plaza Hotel again, if the need arises.

Summary Heading: Here for work but will come back to play!
Summary: I stayed here for a conference, which was well hosted by the hotel.  But the real draw was the wonderful hotel!  All the staff was so friendly (thank you Javier, Sam, and all the front desk people!), and the restaurant was EXCELLENT.  Great food, and generous happy hour specials (late night, too), and the service was outstanding.  Jeremy was our private waiter, it seemed, and he was great.  The grounds of the hotel are beautiful and relaxing, and the pool is lovely.  The room was elegant yet casual and comfortable, and very quiet, and parking was close and easy.  Really everything about this place was perfect.  Being next to South Coast Plaza meant even more restaurants (and shopping) nearby, and it took only a few minutes to get to Newport Beach.  Laguna Beach was also easy to

The Crowne had good internet, clean rooms and comfortable beds. Javier and the rest of the staff were friendly and responsive. I had a very pleasant stay.  The bar/restaurant has great food and a nice patio.

We just stayed here for 3 days. We arrived late at night and had a few hick ups with a new credit card policy so we were told that night checking in. We  have new cards so no raised #s on it. Next morning we came and was greeted by Javier he was very kind and helpful.  He gave us an explanation and the guy the night before was wrong.He was very accommodating. I would give it all 5 except the night before with checking in was a little rough. Javier listened and went over and beyond to help us. He has great customer service skills and you can tell he really enjoys his job. We will stay again and only because Javier made us feel so welcomed. ...
Manager Response: Dear Sweetkiwi6,  Thank you so much for your recent trip to the Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa.  We are sorry about our credit procedures in place, guest security is a number one priority when it comes to your personal information.  We are glad Javier was able to help you so that you could enjoy the rest of your stay.  We hope to see you very soon here at Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa.  Warm regards, Aldo Casanova Sales & Social Media Administrator Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa Orange County   3131 Bristol Street Costa Mesa, CA 92626 D  714 557-3000 F   714 957 8957

Summary: The staff was amazing! Our rooms was beautiful, AND CLEAN! Overall just an amazing weekend away. A special thanks to Javier at the front, Steve and Jeremy in food/beverage, and last but not least CHARLES!!

From the moment we walked,in Javier was more than gracious.  He was so positive, so welcoming, and made our trip so comfortable.  We then were able to have most enjoyable lunch in the tavern.  There too, we were greeted pleasantly, and enjoyed an absolutely wonderful meal. I don't remember his name, but we were there on July 13th.  We also enjoyed room service the next night, and Jeremy, was also stellar.  We had such a great time at the pool, that we stayed another night.  Definitely will recommend this hotel to friends and family, and hope to visit you in the future.

great location and the rooms were even better. Hotel staff was pleasant and nothing buy high fives for everyone there. I would recommend this to all. Close to everything.  There are lots of choices in orange county, I am staying here for business

The location is great! The rooms very comfotable and clean!! But what will bring me back is the SERVICE!!! The staff are all about the customer from Chris at the front desk making sure my room was just what I wanted and when he discovered I really wanted a tub he made a room change and brought the new key to my room to relocate me. Then Cesar in the dining room for breakfast being so personable and giving me locations of local shops when I mentioned looking for something specific, he actually wrote them down and brought the list to me...Impressive. Then we go to Dinner and our server Leah is knowledgable about the menu and delivered excellent service and to top it off the manager Allene checked on us as well and made sure everything was perfect with our overall experience. We

The whole place is nicely renovated. They don't have central AC though so that was the only down side. I tend to find the wall ACs a bit too loud for my taste especially when I'm sleeping. That was the only reason I knocked down a star. This place is dog friendly which is a plus. But I found the dog friendly rooms are not as nice as the non-dog friendly rooms. I originally was in a non-dog friendly room but last minute I had to pick up my dog from the dog sitter and bring her to the hotel so they moved me to a dog friendly room and I noticed the difference a bit. But it wasn't a too big of a difference. All in all, I stayed here pretty comfortably

Summary Heading: always pleasant, quiet...overall very relaxing vibe
Summary: I have stayed at this property numerous times, and it is consistently laid-back, the vibe very smooth and chill, the staff extremely accommodating, and professional.  Special requests are always addressed efficiently, staff at the front desk always has a very "can do" attitude, and they ask me each time I pass by the front desk if there is anything that I need, or if they can do anything for me. EVERY person at the front desk was wonderful but, I would like to make mention of Erick, Cesar, Javier, Rob, and Imelda--just outstanding customer service from them all!  The hotel is somewhat "dated" but I find it to sort of compliment the overall culture of the hotel.  Very soft bleu forms the base for the public areas, and tones thoughout the hotel follow the muted, understated tone.

The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Javier was very helpful as well as Elizabeth and Brenda. The service was excellent and the room was very clean and comfortable. We really enjoyed our weekend stay and are looking forward to staying there again in the future.

Had stayed here before when it was the Hoilday Inn but since then it has been remodeled and now rebranded into a Crowne Plaza and it shows. Good tidy up and great rooms and very good value for money as well. Very good freeway acess to the 405 freeway and very handy to the South Coast Plaza shopping centre make for a good reason to stay here.

We spent several nights here and the Staff were exceptional. Couldn't have wished for more in that regard.Javier, Ron, Erick, Imelda, Bethza, Cesar and Emily were all great. Rooms were great, spacious and very comfortable.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel, attentive and friendly staff
Summary: I really appreciated the service provided by the hotel staff. The shuttle drivers were exceptionally friendly and patient. Greg was able to give me ideas for dinner and it was greatly appreciated because I was alone on a business trip and had never been to the area before. I also want to mention the excellent service of the front desk staff. They were all extremely helpful and willing to go the extra mile. Sam and Javier were willing to answer any questions I had. To top it all off, the hotel was very clean and well decorated. The atmosphere is very inviting. I would definitely stay here again!

Checked in for one night (wish it was more) so we could hang out at the OC beaches. The staff was super friendly and very helpful. Gave us the low down on places to go. Our room was sooo comfortable. They are a little small but the coziness, the cleanliness, the nice bathroom and view overlooking the pool could not be beat. Absolutely loved staying here and cannot wait to go back! Wish we had time to hang out in the hot tub and heated pool as it looked very inviting. Another plus is it is close to John Wayne airport and across the street from South Coast Plaza, which we did not have enough time to shop at but will next time. :) Very clean, nice hotel and a great rate!

We recently spent two nights at this hotel while attending a wedding nearby. The rooms were spotless and of a reasonable size. Bed was quite comfortable. Location is right off 405 and is less than 10 minutes away from the Orange County (SNA) Airport. Definitely recommend!

We spent three nights here on a business conference - and was not disappointed.  Check in was quick and smooth.  The room I was allocated was of a good size - and appeared to have been recently refurbished to a modern, high standard.  The bathroom deserves particular praise - excellent power shower!  (I understand that the whole hotel has been refurbished recently)  There is a nice pool area at the back of the hotel, with a smallish gym.  All members of staff I encountered were always willing to help and were very knowledgeable.  The other beauty of this whotel is that its literally a 10 minute walk away from the South Coast Plaza Mall with all the shops and eateries it has to offer.  I wouldn't come to Costa Mesa on a personal trip - but this is an excellent hotel and would

Summary Heading: Best and most friendly service I have had at a hotel since the ritz
Summary: From the front desk to the bartender Tiffeny, the restaurant manager Steve, the security personnel, Jeremy and the wait staff excellent service and always with a smile.. The bar and restaurant area are very nice and the fire pits outside make for a nice area to relax.. I gave the rooms a 4 bc at least the one I had was overlooking the backyards of some homes that were not maintained very well .. I don't think it's something that the crowne can fix outside of throwing a big tarp over the neighborhood lol. I would def stay again just ask for a room on the other side!

This hotel has changed names over the years, but has now been rebranded as a Crowne Plaza. And it is excellent. Comfortable, clean rooms and a very obliging staff who actually seem to care about their guests - such a breath of fresh air compared to the increasingly dodgy Hilton Costa Mesa over the road (where I have also stayed on occasion). The Crowne Plaza is undoubtedly THE place to stay in the John Wayne Airport/ South Coast Plaza area!

Well worth coming to stay in this hotel. Large, comfortable room, spotlessly clean, with good amenities, such as a spray to help you sleep, and revitalising foot balm. Lovely rain shower too. Staff were very helpful. Parking is free, unlike the Hilton across the road (which is also more expensive).  Breakfast is $11.50 (Hilton is $22!!!). I'd happily stay here again. One slight damper is that the air conditioning unit is very noisy.

I stayed at this hotel for three nights. It is clean, pleasant, and the food is decent. The free shuttle to and from the airport, and to neighboring sites was convenient.  What sets this hotel apart is the service.  The banquet staff, especially Antonio, was efficient, and accommodating.  Imelda and Chris at the front desk were friendly and went out of their way to answer questions and offer help. The shuttle drivers, Omar and Gregory, were also friendly and helpful. If I am ever in Costa Mesa again, I would stay again at this hotel.

My party stayed at the Crowne Plaza from April 3 to April 6 2014.  It was my second time at this hotel.  I would definitely return again!!!  The beds are so comfortable, the rooms are clean, and the showers are just wonderful!!!!  The food in the newly renovated restaurant was delicious!  The pool area was clean with lots of loungers and chairs available.  Lastly, the staff are just amazing.    Always ready to serve, with a smile on there faces.  All the staff were fabulous yet a few were exceptional~Imelda, Sam, Javier, Richard, Brenda, Marrisa, and Arturo!!!  I am already looking forward to my next visit!!!

I stayed at the Crowne Plaza hotel on May 2-May 5th.  Overall, the experience was a pleasant one.  Check in and Check out was painless.  A very nice gentleman by the name of Javier was super nice and made sure that we were very happy with our stay.  The pool was nice and clean with plenty of seats and cabanas outside.  The overall decor of the hotel was very glamour chic...just like my style!  The shower in the room was amazing with the rain shower head.  The room was very clean.  The only reason why this place gets a 4 star vs. a 5 star is because of the following reasons:  1) No microwave or fridge in the room, 2) The armoire in the room that was intended for you to keep your clothes in, did not allow much space to open the door...it was right there when you walked in and if

I CAN'T tell you how impressed I was with this hotel. I upgraded to a suite because I had to bring my 20 month old daughter. I really really need to give kudos to Javier, Jenny, Eric (server who I swear lives there), and the front desk gentleman (I can't remember his name, sorry!!)  They were so accomodating and sweet with my daughter. I was there for a work trip and my mom and daughter had so much fun!   the food at the restuaraunt was delicous, and the rooms were super clean.  The shuttle was great for us to get around.  There is a mitsuwa market close by.   These folks have really set the bar high for every hotel!! and I travel alot!!!!  they even had a good crib

Summary Heading: This is the best hotel ever
Summary: I love the Crowne Plaza in Costa Mesa, I have stayed here but many times it has been  freshly remodeled this year and absolutely beautiful all the employees are trained very well they are always very courteous and very helpful the restaurant food was fantastic I had Stephanie the server wait on me last night she was wonderful the front desk is so helpful courteous and kind and Greg the Bellman is first-class service all the way thank you Ellison Williams Aka Tony and guy Academy

Summary Heading: The Kind of Facility That Made Holiday Inn Famous
Summary: The front desk people were just great,friendly and accommodating. The room was as near to perfectly-appointed as could be expected in that price range, and most of the features in the room were new enough to not appear shabby or dated. The cleanliness was outstanding. And, remember this, the best Holiday Inns were built back when heavy construction existed and when hotels were not cheap plaster and thin steel. The double-pane windows and heavy walls and concrete floors and ceilings mean you don't hear people walking above you; and you don't hear noise from the street or from the airport, period. (Like all hotels under $500 per night, they still couldn't get it right about installing the features that make hotel room doors not slam, which is the one sound that defies all

Summary Heading: Service that feels like home....some days even better!
Summary: I have been here twice now both staying and using the meeting facility both times. What really stands out to me is the exceptional service and willingness to help and create a great guest experience.  The staff could not do enough for us, doing their very best to accommodate every request, smiling, listening and taking personal responsibility for getting our needs met.  A special thank you to Keith Allen, Javier and Sam at the front desk and Oscar in the kitchen.  Everyone was great - these folks went above and beyond almost daily.  What would make the stay a 5? The service WAS a 5! Better systems in the meeting room for video and audio.
