We work very hard to ensure our facilities and guest services are superior and strive to be the best hotel around. For that reason, the comments are troubling and will certainly be looked into. Thank you for staying and we hope you give us another chance to make your stay as best as it can be.  Sincerely,  Anthony M Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: My husband and I, along with our small dog, stayed over a week in April. We do a lot of traveling and have stayed in hotels all over the world. All the staff members were very professional and worked hard to make our stay the most relaxing and pleasant in recent memory. We had everything we needed in our room and the grounds were well kept and quiet. We were very busy around town and with all the great dining in the area we didn't dine at the hotel, but, we did enjoy the bar and drinks outside. I'm originally from Southern California so when looking for a hotel (for such a long stay) I knew that Crown Plaza/Costa Mesa was in a really nice part of town, near some of the best shopping in Orange County, a large airport, Disneyland, Angels Stadium and (most importantly) The Beach!

We stayed here last June when we took my step son on his first trip to Disney Land.  We wanted a nice hotel at a reasonable price.  That is what we got at this hotel!  The staff were all pleaslant. The rooms we spacious, nice decor, clean and the beds were comfortable.    They did have a small pool, that was good enough for kids, and nice loungers to sit and get a tan while they play.  We did have a few meals in the restaurant and the meals were good.  The location was also great, close to the freeway so we could get anywhere we needed.

It seems that the Crowne Plaza / Costa Mesa took the time to insure that you have a wonderful stay. The bed was VERY comfortable.  You had your choice of pillows for your comfort. The colors in the room were a soothing, calming feel. There was even a miniature "spa" package which was small tubes of different lotions & oils for soothing, calming & reveniating. I liked that they took the time to see to the details. The front desk staff were very pleasant & friendly. I would definately recommend this hotel.

I recently stayed here due to problems with a flight. I was really surprised at how good this hotel is. We were a large group with a very late booking that was bused is. The hotel managed to put on lots of extra staff to get rooms ready, food served and people booked in. And they did it quickly and in such a friendly manner considering how hectic it was. Foyer is quite nice. I had breakfast as well and it very decent. There is a buffet and a la carte. The small downfall was the hallways. They were not renovated yet, carpet was old and they smelled of stale cigarette smoke. I found this disconcerting as I am not used to smoking in hotels anymore and find the smell offensive. That said, my fears were allayed once I entered the rooms. I stayed in a king room. It was quite a good

The crowne plaza is centrally located to major highways. Close to shopping and Dining. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Rooms a are nicely appointed. Bed is reAlly comfortable and the pillows were awesome! Nice pool area and hot tub! Only ate breakfast at the restraunt twice but it was good both times. Loved the small "boutique" feeling of the hotel". Chris at the front desk was exceptionally friendly and helpful. Highly Reccomend this hotel!

I really like this hotel for many reasons. Most of all, the location is very convenient....just off the 405 (yet quiet), and very convenient to lots of restaurants and the South Coast Plaza mall about a 7-10 minute walk across the highway. I understand from my friends that folks like to stay here because it's very convenient to Disneyland, and the rates are far less expensive! I noticed that most people staying here were on business.  The rooms are decent size, are very nicely decorated, and the beds are very comfortable. I made sure I got a quiet room as I was worried that one facing the main road would keep me awake at nights. I got a room overlooking the pool and the residential neighborhood at the back so it was mostly very quiet.....except on occasion when the dog next door

I've stayed at the Crowne Plaza twice in the past year due to work conferences that I occasionally have to attend in the area. My job lets me request where I stay so the first time I stayed here, I just picked it based on the location, price, and pictures. I enjoyed my original stay so much that I requested to stay here again. The staff is friendly, the rooms are clean and comfortable, and the lobby is just fancy. Both times that I have visited there was always ample parking and you can request a quieter part of the hotel if you'd like. My second visit, I did notice that from the 3rd floor on the pool side I could hear children screaming and just commotion from the pool area even after 9pm so if you have to go to bed early, then you might want to request to be on the non-pool

Our organization used the Crowne Plaza for a conference. The facilities were just right for our meeting, and perfectly close to the airport. I was served so graciously by the staff, and want to give kudos particularly to Frank, the man at the front desk who helped me with a problem I had, going above and beyond to make sure my need was met. The only caveat I'd have is that shower supplies and glassware were not replenished in our room for our second day.

I stayed at the Crown Plaza as it was in close proximity to John Wayne Airport. I was pleasantly surprised by the in house restaurant, The Savoy. My check in went smoothly and I was comped for my IHG status with some bar vouchers and a parking voucher.   The room was very nice and on par with typical Crowne Plaza's.   I was on a business trip and the internet was quick and the staff very helpful with sending faxes and facilitating printing of some documents.   I really liked the experience at the Savoy. The staff at the bar was very friendly and made an excellent suggestion as the happy hour appetizers were half off. I had two of the seared tuna which was very good and the chef made up some fresh wasabi for me.

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel in Costa Mesa, CA
Summary: What a clean and friendly hotel! The location is near to the shopping mall and a lot of good restaurant. The rate is excellent, too. If you go Orange County, you need to stay at the CROWNE PLAZA, COSTA MESA. YOU WILL LOVE IT. Susie North Hollywood, California

Summary Heading: Excellent Stay during OC Marathon weekend
Summary: I was very impressed with the hotel, staff and overall cleanliness of the hotel.  During a very busy OC marathon weekend, and a convention group, the hotel managed to keep an air of quiet calm. Front desk staff were attentive and sweet, the breakfast buffet was quite good. Centrally located & a few minutes drive from South Coast Plaza Mall. I would definitely stay here again.

I arrived from Latin America after a grueling trip and I met one of the friendliest front office team ready to check me in. Frank Atayde and Chris made me feel so at home with their well mannered and courteous service. Frank is a thorough professional & has indepth knowledge of the Priority Club reward program and how to treat loyal customers which was very refreshing as this was my 4th IHG hotel in a row in the last 2 weeks. Was feeling pretty hungry and decided for late night meal at the bar where I met Ashley, the friendly bartender with great people skills and a permanent smile. Ashley has a great personality & truly enjoys her job and customers & it's the way to go in the hospitality business. Breakfast was a horror the next day and has been so ever since mainly because the

Most recently stay here; I received excellent service and rooms. As a fact, it‚Äôs really nice hotel to stay in Costa Mesa, all people are in Hotel really good and wonderful service.  Especially thanks to Frank and Lounce, they always helped me entire stay in hotel.  I plan to stay at same location...without any hesitation.

Summary Heading: Excellent choice for a quality stay
Summary: The Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa is a nice spot for a quality stay.  I stayed in a executive suite king room and it was great.  The bed was very comfortable and the room was wonderfully clean.  The hotel overall is decorated in a very trendy style and the atmosphere was excellent.  From other reviews I had read, I was a little concerned about the noise factor, but this did not materialize at all.  The main street out front is very busy, but with the window shades shut, I did not hear anything above the level of gentle white noise.  I did stay on weeknights, so it could be worse on a weekend night, but I don't think noise is overall a big problem here.  The room was spacious and comfortable.  The only potential topic of discussion is the size of the closet.  It was sufficiently

Summary Heading: Awesome stay! What more can I ask for?
Summary: Elizabeth at the front desk you are awesome!!! After traveling on the road for 8 hours and seeing the same sleepy faces all day it was nice to have an warm and inviting welcome to the hotel. She allowed me to do an early check in and checked me in with no issues what so ever. People who genuinely love their job, provide great service, and do it with a smile should definitely be recognized and I believe she should be applauded for what she does! Thank you for providing such a wonderful stay! P.S your light up vanity mirror is awesome and is a girls gift from heaven when doing make up. Great addition!! Lol

My husband and I stayed here while visiting family. This has to be one of the cleanest, relaxing hotels we have ever stayed at. Check in was very fast and easy. The employees at this location are very friendly, helpful and accommodating. We also had a wonderful complimentary breakfast in the restaurant. Our room was very nice and the bed was very comfortable. The only thing that I would suggest is for new doors on the bathrooms that actually lock and an exhaust fan in the bathroom as well. Other than that, our stay was perfect! Will definitely be staying here again!

I've stayed at this hotel before when it was called something else & i enjoyed it just the same. It was worth every bit of the drive from LAX for the comfortable rooms & bar. The staff was pleasant & the lounge was a treat after a long day of fun. The bar was awesome & Ashley the bartender was very helpful with great recommendation on drink choices & bar food which made up for the poor breakfast service we received that morning due to a very rude staff member who was a lady of Hispanic decent who walked by several times yet didn't speak or help with silverware or take our drink orders, but made damn sure to give us our check which was complimentary breakfast & the lady even had the nerve to bum-barged us as we left to see if we paid yelling loudly across the lounge as we left

Most recent stay here, I received excellent service and the order was accurate. As a fact, I hadn't even approached my table and Erik was already there to ask what I wanted to drink. Lupe also was serving me by simply asking me if I needed anything as he walked by. This is amazing!! Why doesn't other restaurants do the same (?) - This would revolutionize the whole industry! The service here is actually typical of this hotel. I am undergoing medical treatments now but when I return to the area (July), I plan to stay at same location...without any hesitation. Everyone is great at this hotel. IHG and CP should use this location as a training ground for each respective area of service. The manager is outstanding, which may be the reason of such dedicated staff. My stay: April 8-12,

Summary Heading: The worst breakfast you can imagine
Summary: The hotel itself is ok. Clean, comfortable. The reason why I would never stay here again is breakfast. Had to stay there for a week last March. Because we had to leave early every day, we had no time to stop anywhere else to eat. Shame, because their breakfast can spoil your mood. The choice is poor, every day it's exactly the same thing, and for some really weird reason their Danish pastries and croissants are ALWAYS stale, as if they were bought a week earlier! There is no toast or normal bread at all and if you ask for it, they look at you as if you asked for something really fancy. Whether you get juice or not depends on the mood of a waiter that particular day.. The whole experience is infuriating and enough to put you of staying there ever again..
Manager Response: Dear bewareofkate,  Thank you for taking the time to post your comments. I am happy that you found our rooms to be comfortable for your stay. However, please accept my apologies that the breakfast served during your travel did not live up to standards. I have taken note and wish to thank you for your valuable comments as this is our best means of improving guest satisfaction.  Regards,  Pam G. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: From the minute I walked in, I was treated rudely! Front desk person was extremely rude and even at one pointed tried to accuse me of being a liar. We clearly stated when booking online that we were travelling with our pets, even got an email confirmation that the hotel sent us but then the front desk guy said that we did not mention. We had no help with our bags, just stare-downs and then later found 3 bugs in our room. Finally, we were rudely woken up at 8 am with threats that if our pets (2 small dogs that don't bark at all) made any noise while left in the room alone while we were out that "we would have a problem"!! Why charge for a pet fee and claim to be "pet friendly" if you're going to harass the ppl who come with their pets?!! We were so upset and disgusted by how we
Manager Response: Dear pinchy29,  Thank you for taking the time to review our property. I‚Äôm very sorry to hear about your experience on your recent stay.  I would love the opportunity to regain your faith in our hotel and would welcome the opportunity to discuss your stay in further details. We have sent you a private message to obtain additional detail regarding your stay. I look forward to hearing from you and being of further assistance.  Sincerely,  Connie D Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: Great hotel location & Frank is the best!
Summary: We recently stayed here to attend my sister's wedding last Friday. The lobby, restaurant and room were modern & updated. The hot breakfast buffet was good and there was always cold water with lemon at the lobby for arriving guest. My sister's bridal suite was nice. Overall, our experience was great but the most I want to commend is Frank the front desk receptionist. He went over and beyond our expectations. Our cousin from Wisconsin got stuck at the airport waiting for the shuttle but she was asked to take the cab and the hotel paid for the inconvenience. Frank was very warm and accommodating to all our questions and requests. His partner Grant was also great. I definitely will stay in this hotel again.

Great location, clean rooms, looks remodeled on inside, clean linens, comfortable beds and pillows. great shower and bathroom amenities. Good happy hour, Ashley our bartender friendly as well as other employees. Would stay there again

Summary Heading: Superior Service & Perfectly Located -Don't Hesitate to Book!
Summary: The guest service at Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa was the best I've experienced in any hotel.  Both Grant and Lance (Front Desk) went above and beyond in helping me with various needs in the most professional and gracious manner.  The hotel is elegantly appointed, restaurant and bar are on-site, and convenient shuttle service is cordially provided, not just to the airport but to nearby South Coast Plaza and elsewhere (call to check-if you have meetings nearby, you may not need a vehicle).  Would definitely return.

Summary Heading: Wonderful service, nice pool, elegant rooms
Summary: My boyfriend and I are having a wonderful stay here. The grounds of the hotel are very nice and the rooms cute and comfortable. Last night we had a wonderful time eating and drinking at the bar. We met several nice people and our server/ bartender Ashley is the BEST. We will definitely return to this hotel next time we are in the area.

Come here! Friendly staff and very accommodating thank you Grant and Frank we felt so special with all your extra help.  Excellent location and rates. We were here for a 4 day educational seminar and we will return here from now on when in Costa Mesa.

I can't believe how wonderful I was treated. Frount desk. Grant and Frank were so helpful and kind. I am here for school and plan on coming back. Service great food was delicious.I felt like royalty all the way. Thanks Guys. Ellison Williams

Ashley is a lovely person and a excellent bartender.. I love her personality, patient, and professionalism. This is a beautiful place to stay. The room are excellent and the staff is courteous. I would recommend anyone to stay here at the Crown Plaza Hotel.

Summary Heading: One of the best Crowne Plaza hotels I have been in.
Summary: Overall the stay was excellent! I had to be at the John Wayne airport twice every day for two weeks. The airport is only an 8 minute drive. I stay in Crowne Plaza hotels about 70 nights a year and I must say that this newly refurbished Crowne Plaza stands out in every way. The hotel is quiet, professional and close to the airport and shopping malls. (one of the biggest malls is just a 5 minute drive).  The frontdesk personnel is very committed to helping you in every way. I am from Europe so took the opportunity to have a lot of packages delivered to the hotel while I was in the USA which worked like a dream. They even went out of their way to help me ship some packages as well. Front desk staff like Grant and Frank make a real difference to a business stay.  The standard room

Hotel was very nice and clean. The front desk agent Jorge was very pleasant, professional and helpful. He helped us at check in and check out and made the beginning and ending of our trip memorable. The restaurant was very nice and great service. The room was nice, modern and quite spacious. I would definitely go again.

I stayed at this Crowne Plaza Hotel in April 2013.  The rooms have European styling and were fairly spacious.  I am not a fan of European styling so I will stay elsewhere in the future.  The hotel is convenient to the Seal Beach, Huntington Beach, and Newport area.  Large shower but you have to turn it on while standing in the shower (brrrrrr).
Manager Response: Dear timeoffagain,   Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent visit at our hotel.  We work very hard to ensure our facilities and service are superior and we strive to be the best Holiday Inn around. It sounds like we fell below your expectations, and I apologize you were not satisfied with the room accommodations. I have taken note and wish to thank you for all your valuable comments. These are of great importance to us and allow us to monitor and improve our service continually. Thank you again for your review and we hope to have an opportunity of welcoming you back again soon.  Sincerely,   Janice A Case Manager  IHGCare

Summary: Hotel was perfect. The room was clean, and had everything you would expect from a Crowne...!  Went to the bar for a quick drink before going out to dinner. Ashley at the bar was super nice. Great and easy to talk to. I will be staying here again.

Stay was great. Had good time. Comfortable rooms. Bartender Ashley was very friendly great service.everything in the hotel was nice rooms are very nice and fancy. Restaurant was very good and taste everything I are was great for breakfast and dinner.

Front Desk: Javier, Jorge, Elizabeth, Corina, Frank, Erin, Andrew. In Room Dining: Javier. Restaurant/Bar: Amy, Caesar, Emily, Erick, Luptina, Shuttle Drivers: Greg, Augustine. Housekeeping: Rosa. Maintenance Crew: Danilo, Isaac, Fernando, Anthony, Dan. As you can see from my list the employees from just about every department made our nine day stay truly unforgettable. It was as if they were welcoming us into their own home. It was their level of service that really put it over the top for us. I even barged in on their General Manager: Mr. Charles Harber because I felt compelled to make him aware of how wonderful his staff is. my husband and I are in the hotel/hospitality industry and have been for more than 30 years. You can count on us to be overly critical - we can help it -

I stayed at this hotel for one night, but I wish it was for a week!  The front desk staff is fantastic.  The restaurant is really good.  I had some time to interact with the sales team and they were some of the best I have seen around!  You will not go wrong staying at this hotel.

Summary Heading: Great deal, great hotel, nice rooms
Summary: Stayed here for only only one night, arrived around 8:00 pm so I decided to eat at the bar/rest. After I checked in, the room was extremely nice and comfortable, plenty of towels, pillows, toiletries, food was amazing at a fair price putting into consideration that hotel prices are higher than everywhere else, had a couple of drinks and went to enjoy my room, unfortunately  there was a fight between a couple next door but a minute later I called the front desk security was sent over and stopped the fight. Wished I had stayed longer......now I relocated to this area but when friends come to visit I won't hesitate to book this hotel. Highly recommended!!!!!!!,

Stayed during a business trip - nice, clean room and convenient location - nearby the South Coast Plaza!  Had a parking fee but was reasonable. Fast checkout with Jorge and Javier.  The bed was very comfortable and quiet.  Bathroom had plenty of hot water for the shower

Summary Heading: A Good Choice near the John Wayne Airport
Summary: I have stayed at a number of Crowne Plazas.    Some are patched over Holiday Inns and some are first class.      It is hard to know which you will encounter when you book an unknown Crowne Plaza, which makes me cautious about booking them.       This is a very fine property and a great value.      It is ten minutes from the airport by car, conveniently located in the south Orange County area.         I was upgraded to an executive room which would be considered a fine room anywhere.      Parking, internet, etc., were convenient and without charge.      The breakfast, was a buffet style affair in a stylish setting, but I believe that this was the only part of the property that was somewhat lacking.....lacking in choices, not necessarily in quality.       This is definitely a

I've spoken to a handful of front desk attendants at this hotel and all of them were very kind, pleasant, and accommodating! George, Lawrence (I Think that's what his name was, but he worked at 1AM 4/5/13), and another front desk attendant whom was a female (can't remember her name, but she works fairly late too) were so happy to answer all my questions instead of just transferring me to reservations!! The hotel & staff is amazing and everyone should definitely should get recognized for all their hard work! Keep it up guys! Definitely will be returning on my upcoming trips!!

Excellent service from reception staff karina and Frank. I have stayed at many hotels and resorts on the West coast and staff at the Crown Plaza is first class. I look forward to staying here in the future.

I stayed at Crowne Plaza for business and was pleasantly surprised by the customer service and excellent facilities that it offered. The bartender Ashley is amazing! Very professional, courteous and a pleasure to be around. She has excellent customer service skills and I appreciate her willingness to converse with the guests.

Summary Heading: Look good on the outside, but the inside still counts.
Summary: I must say, I need to start writing good reviews also as I am only contributing to the negative banter on the internet. This hotel looks great, the staff seems to be quite friendly, the ambiance is enjoyable, and the gym is top notch. Why then would I write a negative review?  Simply because there are no Holy Bibles bedside. Not only are they not available bedside, but when you call the front desk to ask for one, there are none in the whole building. It is sad when Bibles are provided and placed at no cost to a hotel, that a place that put this much time effort and money into making their guests comfortable forgot such an important item.  One other thing to mention, the business center has two leased computers that require a credit card to use at a rate of 6.95/15 minutes. I am
Manager Response: Dear Campman612,  Thank you for your feedback. I appreciate your compliments of our hotel, however, we regret letting you down on some aspects of your stay. We take our guest comments very seriously and always strive to provide comfortable and friendly accommodations.  If there is anything we can do to make your next stay more comfortable, please do not hesitate to ask the Manager on Duty.  Sincerely,   Connie D Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: I spent one night at the Crowne Plaza in Costa Mesa, California, and found the room to be very clean, very comfortable and attractive.  The bed was amazingly comfy, and I wonder what kind of mattress or topper was on it!  My room had no tub, but an excellent shower instead.  On the vanity was an electric makeup mirror with appropriate light settings and magnification on one side, a very nice touch!  The young people at the front desk were very sweet and helpful, and I am glad to write this review to let the traveling public know about this reasonable, excellent overnight stay in Costa Mesa, Ca.  This was a combination business-friends trip.                               Natalie from Toronto

Summary Heading: Fantastic bang for the buck; really nice
Summary: We didn't take advantage of the amenities but found this hotel to be very quiet, comfortable, and with great service, which we did use.  Good work space if you're traveling on business and very easy on/off the freeway.

Summary Heading: Excellent Service Karina and Frank Front Desk
Summary: The front desk service from Kanna and Frank was unbelievable they both met my needs for a quiet room and were very gracious after a difficult day of traveling.  I will keep coming back to this hotel.  The shower is great and the amenities in the room fabulous for the value.  Joe

Summary Heading: Wonderful experience, friendly and helpful staff
Summary: I had a wonderful stay with my sons baseball team from Doane college Nebraska last week. From Grant Haas at the front desk, Victoria Lewis in the office, Greg the courtesy shuttle van driver, the maid service, so many I can't remember all their names. I do know this that it all comes from leadership, Lori Puddester director of sales is a prime example of how she runs her hotel,  is how I try and run my Supper Market in Fresno CA. Giving the customer the best shopping experience, with a clean business,  and friendly caring employees, Thanks again for the wonderful stay Doug Achelpohl

I recently stayed four nights at the Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa. The well decorated room was extremely comfortable, with plenty of work space.  The bathroom has a spa type atmosphere.   Because of the outstanding customer service of both Jorge and Javier, I decided to take a moment to share my experience, as the high quality customer service they provided is a rare commodity today.  When I asked about a late check out, I received an immediate positive response.  I highly recommend Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa.

I have traveled extensively over the years and have stayed in many hotels so I feel that I am a good judge.  I am a frequent guest at this particular hotel and love it.  The staff is amazing.  Grant and Frank at the front desk are a complete delight and always make me feel that I am their most important guest!  I have to admit that they treat everyone that way which is even better!  Javier who tends bar and serves is wonderful.  I am a director of customer service for a company and often refer to the team here as a model of customer service. In addition to the staff, the rooms are very comfortable and the shower is the best ever!  I highly recommend this hotel and want to say a big thank you to all of the wonderful staff!

Summary Heading: Great staff, making sure your needs are taking care of.
Summary: I stayed 5 nights and the staff was very courteous and professional. Frank, Grant and Elizabeth just to name a few we're awesome. The food is good waiters are fast. Rooms are keep very clean, comfortable beds, flat screen small work station and good wifi. Thanks for making my stay comfortable.  Happy camper!

I recently visited Costa Mesa and stayed at the Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa Jorge and Javier were so helpful and wonderful- they helped me so much after my luggage was lost from the airline- these guys were on top of it from the moment I entered the hotel.  They should be commended for their outstanding service. The hotel was great and very comfortable.  I would definitely stay there again.!!!

I frequently stay at the Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa on business, and my needs are always accommodated by the very courteous staff. If I need to check in early or check out late, never a problem. Particular praise goes to Jorge, of the front desk staff, and to Javier as well. They made sure I had everything I needed and wanted when I checked in. Very pleasant and professional.

Reading the previous reviews, I was torn whether to stay at the Crowne Plaza or the Westin... I definitely made the right choice!! This hotel is very modern, chic and elegant! The lobby is beautiful, and the restaurant has a very classy ambiance. Some had written about the hall ways needing a little updating and I agree. The rooms are VERY nice and clean! I had an executive king suite and it was spacious! Beds very comfy, bathroom is excellent and again extremely clean!!  There's even great soaps, shampoo's and conditioners! A little treat that I found so fun was a little sleep tight kit- soothing lotions and a spray that has essential oils to help you rest well... Love it! Well done Crowne Plaza!!

Summary Heading: High on Value, a wonderful place to stay.........
Summary: I recently had a wonderful stay at the newly remodeled Crown Plaza.  The staff was extremely  friendly and attentive especially Jorge at the front desk.  The rooms were very nicely decorated and the bed was very comfortable.  Both the pool and hot tub were heated which made for a nice experience on those chilly evenings.  Also, the food was outstanding in their restaurant.

Stayed here a week for business. Was given a room in the "Executive" wing. Nice and quiet! Entire room was very clean. The bed was really comfortable with lots of pillows to choose from. The room had a sofa bed as well. Nice not to always have to sit on the bed or in the desk chair. Bathroom was large enough with a super shower - one of those rain shower heads. There was also a hand held shower head, if you wanted to use that. Water drained well from the tub! (Nothing worse than standing in inches of dirty water.) They offered average amenities of shampoo, conditioner, hand cream, and soap. I was surprised that the room did not have a little refrigerator. They do have them as an extra you can request for $10/day. They took this off my bill at the end for being an Ambassador

Stayed here for 3 days on business.  It has a nice location next to the mall for evening dinners and to just waste some time.  The breakfast buffet was good, but I didn't eat any other meals there.  The room was very comfortable, clean and quiet.  It does have shuttle service to/from the SNA airport.  Supposedly, the shuttle also runs to anywhere in Costa Mesa, but every time I asked they were too busy so I ended up taking a cab.

I was on a business trip. Stayed there for a week. Got a surprise bottle of red wine and fruit plate when checked in the room. The King bed is very nice. The service crew were fantastic. A guy from front deck Grant is really good and very helpful. I would stay there again. Only improvement can make is to make different stuff for breakfast.

Working in a hotel myself, I have to say I was thoroughly impressed with the entire stay; the room was immaculate, the setup was accessible and comfortable, the amenities were on par, the bed was SO COMFORTABLE, it was quiet and just aesthetically pleasing overall. Check in and check out we're smooth and efficient with great personalities at the front desk. Andrew and Jorge were stellar at their job. The wedding reception venue was awesome--the staff was incredible. Food was so delicious it was hard to not overfill. I'd totally come back to this hotel in a heartbeat.

Very nice lobby area and restaurant.  Great bar service (thanks Rachel and Eddy).  Very friendly staff.  Some of the public areas, like hallways and elevators, definitely need improvement but the room was very nice/new looking.  Heat/A-C did not work properly.  View out my window was the pool, and someone's back yard.  Pretty convenient to most of my meetings in Orange County, but not in an area where you can walk around to either shop or grab some dinner.  Check-in took way too long, but I was given a free drink coupon for my trouble (I didn't complain, they just offered it). Probably one of the best hotels available at the price point - it was very affordable for the area, probably the same price as a nearby La Quinta or Holiday Inn Express, but with the amenities of a full
Manager Response: Dear MangaMan,  Thank you for your feedback. We take our guest comments very seriously and always strive to provide comfortable and friendly accommodations. We appreciate that you find our location to be convenient.  However, We‚Äôre sorry we fell below your expectation regarding our public area condition and customer service from the front desk. We will look into this point. We are confident the necessary adjustments will be made, in order to ensure complete guest satisfaction.  We hope you give us a chance in the future to show you how great our hotel is.  Sincerely,  Orlando A. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary Heading: Great customer service at cute boutique hotel
Summary: Loved staying at the Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa hotel.  Comfortable, convenient, extremely clean, and most importantly great customer service.  Check in was fast and effiecient and all hotel personnel were extremely friendly and accomodating.  I want to give a thumbs up to Greg the shuttle driver - very nice guy; and also to Grant who is the epitome of great customer service - friendly, personable, and helpful.

Summary Heading: The start to a great relationship.
Summary: The Crowne Plaza in Costa Mesa was fabulous. Their work out facilities are available 24hrs a day and the staff helpsake your stay enjoyable. From the first time you check in everyone is happy to assist. The housekeeping staff was friendly and did a spectacular job daily. At check out Victor was quick, efficient, and helpful.

Summary Heading: Average hotel but good for SNA flights
Summary: I picked this hotel because I had a early morning flight out of John Wayne Airport (SNA) and I didn't want to leave my house at 3:00am. I am a Platinum Priority Club member so I used points for my stay which was a King room.  Checking in was difficult. The guy checking me in was clearly new and was having a very hard time getting me checked in. I asked about the airport shuttle and he said he would make a reservation for me on the 7:00am shuttle. Unfortunately when I showed up for that shuttle my name wasn't on the list but I was able to talk my way on.  The room was average. The bed was confortable as were the pillows. The amoire was right up against the bed however so it felt very clausterphobic. My bathroom sink wouldn't drain and when I called the front desk they stated that
Manager Response: Dear KnowingThisKnow,  We appreciate that you took the time to review our hotel and thank you for being one of our valued Priority Club Platinum Members. I am happy to hear you enjoyed our comfortable beds. I regret that your stay was negatively affected by the level of service received from our hotel staff and condition of the bathroom facility you encountered. We are constantly looking for ways to improve our service and we appreciate that you brought this matter into our attention. Rest assured that these issues will be looked into.  We appreciate your feedback. Thank you for continuous patronage and support to the hotel, and we hope to have an opportunity to serve you again and provide you with a better experience.  Sincerely,  Zelyn N Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: We just stayed there this past week. The rooms are beautiful, the staff was very accommodating and friendly. The location is great, very convenient to shops and local beaches! I definitely will be visiting again.

I stayed here on Feb 23 2013.  The accommodations, service, were nice.  My room on the third (and highest floor) was overlooking the courtyard area.  The courtyard area encompasses the pool and hot tub area.  As with most motels the pool/hottub is closed after 11 pm.  Unfortunately, access to the 'courtyard' area is not.  The glass panes must be very thin because we could hear every word the drunk folks said in the courtyard area.  I called to the front desk to complain.  The offending persons were removed.  I struggled to get back to sleep only to be awakened a second time.  Once again the offending persons were removed with a call to the front desk.   I suspect this is not an isolated event, nevertheless even  to be awoken one time when the main purpose of a hotel is to
Manager Response: Dear Paul W,  Thank you very much for taking the time to write your comments. I understand that having a good night sleep is important and it sounds like we fell below your expectations. I am sorry for any inconvenience you experienced due to the outside noise.  While we understand that your stay was not 100% satisfactory, we would hope that you would give us another chance to make your stay as best as it can be.  If there is anything we can do to make your next stay more comfortable, please do not hesitate to ask the Manager on Duty.  Sincerely,  Ferdinand G. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: This is my first night of three I will spend at your hotel, but I wished to say how impressed I was with the youg gentelman (Jorge), that assisted me upon my arrival. I travel every week, I am a Platinum Priority member and I see and interact with many staff, Jorge, stands out, professional, freindly, and efficient.........good job!!

Summary Heading: Clean, friendly, comfortable. If only there was a view.
Summary: Jorge and Javier were easy to deal with and professional. Hopefully see them them when we return.  Perfect place to stay when coming through Orange County for business. Rooms are large and comfortable but a good coffee was hard to come across. Didn't take away from the stay.

We were looking for a relatively inexpensive hotel to stay at while in the Irvine area for the night.  We were surprised to find the Crowne Plaza in our budgetary range, so we decided to try it out.  What we found was exceptional service, particularity from Grant Haas.  He was highly knowledgeable, very informative and made us feel right at home.  We found the rooms very nicely appointed and were very happy with our stay.  It is employees like Grant that will put the Crowne Plaza at the top of our list for hotels in the OC.

Summary Heading: Very impressed and unexpected for the price
Summary: Very conveniently located and updated decor that is very unlike image of Crowne Plaza. Helpful staff, especially Javier at front desk.  Rooms not large but updated and very stylish yet comfortable. Bonus points for the free parking and nice breakfast buffet. Hidden gem and if you wouldn't normally consider a Crowne Plaza...you be mistaken with this Costa Mesa location.  Will return again

I have stayed here twice now and the staff is so friendly and nice!  Beautifully appointed rooms, adore the shower!!!  Javier and Andrew at the front desk are friendly and helpful. Amy and her and her staff in the restaurant are also very accommodating!    Now David the shuttle driver is so sweet and helpful. He needs to accept tips though!!!  He is stellar.  Thank you all!

We had a great time staying at this hotel.  Very clean rooms.  Every staff member that we came into contact with was exceptional.  Just waiting to help.  We ordered room service.  The food was wonderful.  Very impressed.  We have stayed at this location twice now.  We consider this hotel our home away from home.  We will be back!

Frank at the front desk was amazing. Didn't matter what time of night it was, he was very polite and extremely accommodating. We needed extra sheets at 3 in the morning. He made my experience at the Crowne Plaza great.

I cannot say enough good things about this hotel.  It is obviously well-maintained, but more importantly, the staff is beyond belief.  It started with Jorge at the front desk and ended with Eric in the restaurant.  I am very satisfied with this facility and will stay here again.  I am also impressed with Johan in the lounge.  He is a consumate professional.

My travel agency selected this one for us - good corporate rate.  It appears to be recently remodeled - it has free wifi + nice work desk in the room, comfortable bed, large room. friendly helpful staff.  My only minor complaint and I would have given it an excellent had it not had this artificially induced problem- they just this week started to charge for parking - really? 10 bucks a day to park? and there is nothing special - its not covered or heated - air conditioned nor do they wash and wax your car while its parked out there.  My other minor irritation none of the external doors work with your key card - you have to come in through the front lobby door.  I am sure if you ask you will be told "its for your security convenience and safety" which is the standard response

Summary Heading: Excellent service by Jorge And first impressions are very important, the gentleman was extremely pleasant
Summary: I just checked into this hotel, and it's pretty nice. I normally stay at the other namebrand hotels in the area but everyone was full so I tried the Crowne Plaza for the first time. So far so good. Clean reasonably modern and friendly

Looked for a "non-surfer" hotel near the beach towns and found this! Clean, quality finishes (tile, granite, glass shower). Comfortable king bed and good pillows.  The desk personnel, like Javier, were informative and helpful with all my questions.

Summary Heading: Frank at Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa CA
Summary: Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa CA is our home away from home since last Nov. (for 3 months and we are still staying) while working on a project. Its location is near the SNA airport; breakfast, lunch, and dinner are top of the line; the rooms as well as the bed and pillows are so comfortable and clean. BUT, its best feature is the service especially FRANK at the front desk. He has helped us with extra pillows, water, shuttle bus and just about anything. He always make sure our accomodations are hassle-free and stress-free after a hectic day at work. Thanks, FRANK.

This hotel was easy to get to with close access to the 405, and the hotel front desk staff was super helpful and accommodating!  They even let me use their printed and fax for free instead of paying for the ones in the computer room!  Nice staff, nice rooms, and overall a great stay.

I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Orange County area!! The rooms were excellent, and very clean. The front desk staff went above and beyond to make sure my stay was comfortable. I was always warmly greeted and the staff was most helpful.  The shuttle service was wonderful. They will take you anywhere nearby for dinner or shopping. I was sick and the driver, Greg,  took me to CVS to get some allergy medicine. The hotel is right next to South Coast Plaza so you will have plenty of things to do at night or even shopping during the day.

I should have written my accounts over the past 10+ years, traveling now over 230 days each year. i have stayed at easily over 600 hotels. The last couple of years I have had longer stays.I have been at this hotel three of the past four weeks and it truly is the best Crowne Plaza thus far (maybe out of a dozen). Overall it rates in the top 10% re addressing what I need, and the staff does so quickly. The staff at front desk, especially great at getting things done. Housekeeping, after a couple of issues, did come through and address a couple of items. I wish I could take this hotel with me wherever I travel - wow, only if I could find a way (ha)!

I was surprised to see how good the room was and customer service was awesome.Realy good options on the breakfast.everybody at front were just soo great,Frank did amazing job even when I asked his help 3o clock in the morning .....thank you frank....

I have been meaning to write this review for months.  I was traveling on business and had never been to the Costa Mesa area.  I decided to stay at the Crown Plaza on a whim.  Upon checkin, there was a line at the front desk and one gentleman behind the desk.  A young woman came out..looked like she was looking for something, saw me, gave me a big smile and offered to check me in.  She started the check in process and asked if I had been to the hotel before.  When I said I hadn't even been to Costa Mesa before, she started a conversation with me about various things to do/see around the area.  When the other gentleman was done with his checkin, he stepped over and thanked her.  He explained to me that she didn't work at the front desk, but in sales, and stepped in to help him.

I would like to express my thanks for the great staff you have at the hotel. The restaurant was very good. And I would like to give a thanks to Jorge and Jenny for their help and gracious reception to my mother and myself.

I was very disappointed in the customer service of this company. I was reserving a room online and the date kept resetting to 2 weeks out. I corrected it and confirmed (stupidly not printing out or taking a screen shot). When my confirmation email arrived it had the wrong date again. I called immediately to correct this and they were unable to because apparently now it was booked on the date I needed. They also couldn't put me into a nearby hotel. Since it was a "Book Early" reservation they could not give me a refund. Whoever is in charge of the online system needs to fix this glitch and the company needs to be more willing to help a customer when this happens.
Manager Response: Dear CStang,  First of all, thank you very much for your recent stay at our hotel. I am so sorry to about your overall experience with us. We‚Äôd like to obtain some additional detail regarding your experience so we have sent you a private message. We hope to have the honor of serving you again should your travels bring you back to Costa Mesa.  Sincerely,  Ferdinand G. Case Manager IHGCare

Summary: What can I say, Everyone at the Crown Plaza treats you like a celebrity, the rooms are perfect, makes you feel like you are on vacation,The Dinning room and food are outstanding, I wish I could name everyone because they all work very hard to make your stay special.

We stayed at the hotel on 1/4/2013 and 1/5/2013 in a King-bed room.  The room was spotless, the bed was very nice and the shower was great.  The front desk led by Jennifer and Jorge were very helpful, smiled and helpful.  The wait-staff in the dinning room for breakfast on Saturday and Sunday were amazing.  They were lead by a waiter named Eric who smiled all of the time.  He and the other two gentlemen made us feel comfortable and like members of their families.  They got everything that we asked for and were super.

Summary Heading: Had a wonderful experience, will be back!
Summary: Walking in my hotel room, i was surprised and did not expect the rooms to look like that. The room was absolutely stunning and comfortable, it really did feel like i was on vacation. We arrived a little late and this friendly front desk worker who checked us in (did not get his name) gave amazing service, he was very welcoming and was very accommodating. I was extremely happy with my king bed room and the beds were very comfortable and the room was very very clean. the staff is very very friendly and welcoming, which I liked. The hotel is in a very convenient area (405 freeway right there) and next to Newport Beach.  My only complaints were my room did not have comedy central channel on TV and I experienced poor, slow WIFI internet connection (kept on getting kicked off) and the

Was extremely happy with the property rooms well appointed and spacious. The front desk staff take the cake really making my stay exceptional, Thank you especially to Jorge with his back up Jennifer. We had breakfast vouchers for the restaurant service was great and portions very generous, the smoked salmon plate "yum". They serviced our conference breaks and meals quietly and quickly to pluses when you only have a small amount of time. Oh and really must mention the fun team building cooking competition the executive chef organized for us.

We live close to Costa Mesa, but wanted to make a night out of a concert we were attending nearby, so chose the hotel on a whim.  What a great pick!  The outside is not much to look at but once you get inside, it is beautiful.  The room was spacious and comfortable - and the bed was perfect!  I don't think I have ever encountered a friendlier staff - everyone we spoke to was helpful and accommodating, not to mention full of personality.  If you are looking for a hotel with access to nearby entertainment, this will work!  You have South Coast Plaza right down the street (with free shuttle service to and from the hotel) with a number of great restaurants, not to mention world-class shopping.  Additionally, the hotel is right next to the 405 freeway and very close to Newport Beach.

Our  family checked in only to be surprised with one bed. Immediately we went down stairs and spoke to a gentlemen named J. Mejia. I was extremely impressed how quickly he handled the situation and put us in  a room that  had 2 queen size bed. He so friendly and told us to contact him if we had any other questions or concerns. He also help me print off Disney tickets from the printer that I couldn‚Äôt seem to quite get! :)  When we checked in our room I was satisfied with the overall cleanliness of the hotel, until we got in the bathroom and was welcomed by a spider, vent full of thick dust, and pubic hairs in the tub. With  my dissatisfaction I called the front desk and requested the tub be cleaned out again. My guess it was never actually cleaned, probably just a quick wipe

Summary Heading: Taken Care Of Better Than My Own Family Does !
Summary: It all starts with the reservation process. I had some problems when I called the (800 #) reservations call center. I then called the front desk directly (Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa Orange County) & spoke to Jennifer R. "Guest Service Mgr."   My reservation was corrected perfectly, quickly, & efficiently. The Mgrs. Jennifer & Andrew take pride in their jobs & it shows all the way to the entire front desk staff. They are ALL very professional, knowledgeable, friendly, & always willing to go that extra mile to make a guest feel welcomed. The bar & restaurant staff are always excellent as well. Friendly, professional, & quick with a good joke or two. Food & drinks are consistent, fast, & always really good.  There has been a time or two where we needed shuttle service & like the rest

Summary Heading: Shoes stolen from room - no concession from hotel
Summary: The hotel was okay...nothing special but it did the trick.  The staff was nice initially.  Then my $110 shoes came up missing.  They were 2 week old metallic gold Sam Edelman flats that sell for $110.  I didn't want to accuse the staff of stealing my shoes so initially I said perhaps my toddlers put them in the trash but then realized that I spent 15 minutes picking up the room Saturday morning (Tgiving wknd) and they were not in the trash then.  I know they were there Saturday morning because I wore them late Friday night to leave the room when we had an issue with the thermostat.  We left the room Saturday morning and the shoes were not there when we returned.  They were either taken out with the linens accidentally OR the door was propped open during cleaning and someone

We stayed in Crowne for about 10 days and I can say that it's a really good place to be in. We were thinking about many other hotels nearby, but we never regretted about our choice. It's a cozy and sophisticated hotel in everything. Location is absolutely great, the whole hotel is clean and stylish as well as rooms, gym is nice, breakfasts are just perfect, especially pancakes and omelette :)  We want to say thank you for all staff for being so friendly and helpful. Actually, they helped when they couldn't and that was very nice. Andrew Dominguez, Matt Franchino, Javier James - thank you, guys. I truly believe that people make a place. And you do a great job.  I would recommend this hotel to all perfectionists who need a good place to stay in Costa Mesa, Santa Ana or Irvine. And

Everything about this hotel is Just right!!! friendly staff, clean and spacious rooms and for the price i am sure you cant find anything better around this location. I am pretty sure this hotel is almost at par with the Marriott hotel next door but at half the price which is always a big plus. Besides their in-house restaurant they provide with enough information with close by restaurants that deliver food to Hotel up to 3 AM (yes you heard it right up to 3 AM). The hotel is located right off the freeway too. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is a smart spender (those who don't compromise on quality but don;t believe in spending unnecessarily) ;)

Summary Heading: Crowne Plaza - used to be the Hotel Hanford - Costa Mesa, CA
Summary: I'm giving the Crowne Plaza Costa Mesa a Very Good overall rating, but I had to stop and think because some parts of it are only average.  We have stayed there (Hotel Hanford) at least 4 times in the past two years.  It's in a fabulous area of Costa Mesa very close to a great shopping mall and close to the freeway and not far from the beach! Our room was clean and nice, as always.  The desk in our room is getting old and "used" looking with scratches on front of the drawer.  The carpet is starting to look older.  And there is still NO bathroom fan, so we brought our own fan.  We were on the fourth floor this time, and the carpet from our room to the elevator had some stains on it and it looked old and loose.  I do not like old looking carpet in hotels. The lobby and restaurant

No complaints. I wish I had an excuse to stay another night at the crown plaza. Everyone working there had a smile and were available to answer any questions as well as follow up with me when passing through the main lobby. Matthew, the white Denzel, was very courteous and pleasant to have a conversation with and Jennifer Riveria was able to assist me with a few issues I had with billing. She dealt with my frustrations in a very professional manner and was expedient with the issue at hand. I highly recommend you stay here.

I recently stayed here for two days and was really surprised by just about everything. The room was great and the shower was particularly nice. The restaurant, which I had breakfast and dinner twice was very good, although I wasn't crazy about the Western/Denver omelette. The fitness center is open 24 hours and is decent. I found the staff always eager to go out of their way to provide service, emphasis on always.  To top it all off I got a great rate for an area that tends to be pricey.

My favorite hotel traveling for business!  Extremely comfortable and clean.  Have stayed frequently and have never been disappointed.  The decor is awesome andthe showers are great.  I would recommend forthe business traveller.

Summary Heading: Hotel Nice, Details and Service So-So.
Summary: We stayed a single night for a friends wedding at the Hotel. We paid in advance and made special note to have a room facing away from the freeway. Our stay started off with so-so service from the front desk. We mentioned our preference to stay away from the freeway and were met with some resistance. We were eventually given a room facing away from the freeway but the room had a view of a concrete wall which was disappointing. The decor of the room was nice. The remodel of the bathroom was really nice. The room's air-conditioner leaked onto the rug, we only noticed this the morning when we were leaving when it soaked my socks while attempting to close the blinds. The room had plenty of amenities including, an iron, coffee maker, desk mirror, etc. The service during the wedding

We stayed for 5 days after booking on Priceline to visit my in laws.  Location right by 73 & 405 which was nice. decent fitness center for a non 5* hotel.  The HVAC in the room was simply awful.  Had to move rooms the first day. The next room was better but turned into the same issue. Unit freezes up, sounds like a diesel truck in the room, has a mind of its own regarding on/off and temp.  Didn't get one decent night sleep. the staff is nice. But will not stay here again until I am assured of new cooling system.

We stayed for 2 nights at the end of a 2 week holiday in Southern California. The hotel is well maintained and the room well appointed. We could not find any information on the hotel anywhere in the room and so had to ask at reception about the gym/pool location and hours. The air conditioning is also very noisy and showing its age, even though the resyt of the room seemed quite up to date.  The free parking is great and plentiful and the location perfectly placed just by the I-405 and an easy drive to the coast. South Pacific Plaza is only a 10 minute easy walk away from the entrance.  Overall pretty good value for maney/

This is my second stay at the hotel. I stayed once when it was The Hotel Hanford and now this is the first time since they became the Crowne Plaza. I didn't see any differences since the change in ownership which is awesome! I came here with my boyfriend both times and enjoyed it very much. The front desk staff was friendly, helpful, and accommodating! Grant and Frank specifically provided the best of service. Eddie in room service did a fantastic job and Greg in guest services as well! From beginning to end this place is incredible. I've always had a great room each time with no complaints. I really enjoy this property because it really fits anyones needs. Business travelers, wedding parties, couples, families, they cater to everyone and do it perfectly. I absolutely can't wait

Summary Heading: Very Nice Hotel & Great Customer Service
Summary: We stayed here because my daughter was in a tournament nearby.  We originally checked in and had a King bed but later that night we unexpectedly we needed to upgrade when a teammate needed to stay with us.  The front desk team was very helpful and understanding and was able to accomodate us.   The hotel is location is awesome and easy to find (and next to a McDonalds).    Our rooms were clean and very spacious.  Not sure, but it looked as if the rooms and halls all went through a renovation because they were that neat and and looked new.  Another reason I picked this hotel - free parking. Hate paying an extra $16-20 for that (like you would if you go a mile south).  Only bad thing, if there is one, coffee makers were a little tricky and then after I figured it all out and got

This hotel is conveniently located and my room was large with a comfy bed.  The bathroom was small which would have made it more challenging for two people to spread their toiletries out, luckily I was alone. If you are a light sleeper know that the 405 freeway runs right near the hotel.  There was traffic noise all night long so you may want to ask for a quiet room that doesn't face Bristol and/or bring ear plugs. The staff was very friendly, the room was clean and the bed was comfy. I'd stay here again ~

This has now changed names to the Crowne Plaza, but this has not been updated in Trip Advisor yet.  It was comfortable, with new, sleek wood furniture and all white linens.  The best part was the free internet in lobby and room, and the free shuttle to anywhere within 5 miles, so I could book a rental car away from the airport, which saved me $100.  The front desk staff is friendly and helpful, housekeeping is very responsive, and the room service is friendly and apologetic if they can't get it to you right away and provides updates until they do.   I was attending a conference at the Hilton across the street, and it was easy to walk there.  My group also walked a few blocks over the freeway to the mall, where there were a number of good restaurants. I would have liked a free

We were a bit confused due the hotel's name change (I guess they were bought out by Crown Plaza the previous day) but were informed by the staff that we were at the correct hotel.  The staff was super friendly.  I loved that the wifi internet and parking was free, most of the other hotels in the area charged for both parking and wifi internet which is a bit of a bummer.  Our room was huge and the rain-shower was so relaxing.  It made me want to get one for my own bathroom at home.  I would say our overall experience was positive, the only thing missing was a fridge in the room for snacks and the a/c was very noisy.  If you can get past the small minor things this hotel is definitely worth checking out if you're in the area.  For the price, it's unbeatable.

Rooms are uniquely decorated, beds are very comfortable and roomservice was excellent and not over priced. This hotel also offers free shuttle service within 5 mile radius which was very helpful to us. Pool looked nice and clean as well.

The hotel is located in a very convenient place that is easily accessed from the main highway (405), and it has a big parking lot + garage, the rooms are spacious but the only thing missing was the fridge, you have to pay an extra 10$/day for it and that just didnt make sense. the housekeeping are nice and helpful and most importantly their integrity.

Very nice hotel, brand new furniture and very good service. Our room was very clean and tidy, equipped with every amenity. Big and clean bathroom, many towels and spectacular shower. Small but well equipped gym, nice pool. Very nice and kind staff, available to assist you at anytime! The hotel is close to the freeway, John Wayne airport; Newport Beach and the Irvine Spectrum are only 10 minutes away. Highly recommended!!!

The staff was friendly and helpful given what we had to put up with. The walls are paper-thin. The first night I was woken up multiple times to "ungodly" noises from the room next door. I didn't complain, as the hotel was not responsible for the quality of guests and their inappropriately LOUD behavior. And thin walls is something that couldn't be helped at that point. We also stayed the night of the party last Saturday. We woke up to a crowd of people outside our door trying to enter the room "by drunken mistake." We called down and were told the police and security guards were on it. After half an hour, we realized nothing had changed and called down again. I know more could have been done by the staff and police, but I don't want to discredit what effort they actually made.

We are local So Cal residents, and chose this hotel as a good location to hit up Newport Beach and Disneyland with the kids. The decor of the hotel is cute. Other than that I don't have many positive comments. The hotel staff/management that was on duty during our stay lacked any sort of responsibility at all, and I literally felt unsafe to the point where we left before it was over. In the middle of the night. With the ONE security guard that was on staff escorting us to the car. Not even knowing where we would go. I will admit that one of the nights we stayed was an anomaly, the hotel had booked an event for a large group of 20-somethings, and there were 4-5 people per hotel room all around us. Screaming and yelling. All night. It was not a good place for the family.  It got

For the priced that we paid for, the hotel was excellent. We were mostly there just to sleep as we spent most of our time in Laguna Beach and Irvine. I love the location. It's close proximity to everythiing was amazing. The room itself was very clean and very contemporary with nice bathroom. Took me awhile to figure out how the shower head works haha . But I loved it as the water pressure is strong. The bed was so comfy I can sleep on it all day everyday :)   As we were checking out, we decided to have breakfast. It was a bummer they dont offer complimentary breakfast, but its ok, we most likely wont have it anyway since we tend to get a proper breakfast. The breakfast at Savoy was amazing. My boyfriend loved it. I wish we had our breakfast here on our first day than having it

Summary Heading: Restless nights with a terrible restaurant
Summary: The Hotel Hanford has the appearance of a larger-scale boutique hotel; however, it is far from it. This former Holiday Inn leaves a lot to the imagination. Upon check-in, we were greeted by rowdy guests in the lobby. We were assured by the front desk crew that this was atypical. I was glad in the end that I requested a room away from any unnecessary noise as the hotel hosted special events both nights of our stay.   The room itself was nice enough. No real view, unless you enjoy looking at a highway. I liked the bathroom. The vanity area was spacious enough for two, and I appreciated the shower head. It was, however, difficult dressing with the wardrobe being located so close to the bed. Plus, the lighting in the room was rather poor. More notably, the A/C in the room was

For the rate we received we were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the hotel.  The room was very clean, quiet and decorated nicely.  The staff was very kind when we checked in and out.  We did not have the time to dine at the hotel, so I cannot comment on their food.  But the in room coffee is always a plus.  I am always surprised when we stay at nicer hotels and they do not offer in room coffee.

Very clean and quiet room, very friendly staff, great location (close to a huge shopping Mall), movie theater close by, great authentic Japanese sushi place right across the street from the hotel. Ten minutes away from the beach. Fantastic rates $120 a night.

We were surprised at just how nice this hotel was when we stayed. Room was beautifully furnished and well kept. Everything about the hotel was very nice. If we stayed in the area again this would be our top choice. Our stay at the hotel hanford was very pleasant and a step above most other hotels in the area.

Summary Heading: Lovely property by the best mall in the OC
Summary: The Hanford is an affprdable option if you are staying in Orange County. It is a block away from South Coast Plaza, with convenient access to the freeway. It is next door to a McDonald's, which is great for breakfast. The hotel has free WiFi, a nice fitness room, free parking, and vending machines for late-night snacking. The pool is also nice, and the beds comfortable.

Great location close to John Wayne Airport and the 405 in Costa Mesa makes this spiffy hotel a good choice! Ideal for the business traveller or tourist to the area. Quick check in and contemporary rooms are pleasing and convenient.

This 3 1/2 star property is essentially an upgraded Holiday Inn.  Though the interior photographs well, I found it to have uncomfortable beds and the shower was fairly small...a strange additional comment, but the toilet had a very low profile to the ground, the shower interior was a muddy brown color and felt like plastic.  There was no in-room mini-fridge either, it was an extra charge to request.    The sofa bed was an upgrade, additional charge as well which we agreed to.  When we asked for sheets for the sofa bed, the front desk asked if we would like the bed to be set up for us and it never was.  We had to make 2 additional phone calls to request this after we returned from dinner, hours later with a sleepy toddler.  The front reception crew could use some improvement.

My sister lives 45 min south of Costa Mesa and I'm 45 mins north. After going to a nearby concert we wanted a reasonably priced hotel with a little luxury that did not charge for parking or Wifi and this was the perfect option! We got the last room and were so happy because we did not want to pay $21 for each of our cars across the street at the Hilton. Only wish we would have had time to use the pool! I loved the rain shower!  We both really liked the hotel and my sister was told upon check-in they were going to become a Crowne Plaza hotel starting this week. This could have been the reason for a few tiny things - they only provided one small bottle of shampoo/conditioner, there was no on/off switch for the bathroom vent even though there was one, there was no mini-frig,

Just about everything was top-notch at this hotel, from the most helpful staff, to the large rooms with comfortable beds, fluffy pillows, and free parking. The Keurig coffee brewer in the room was a nice touch.   My peeve?  They skimp on the amenities. There was one sad little bottle of Pantene shampoo and one sad little bottle of Vaseline lotion.  And a couple of bars of generic soap.  No conditioner, no hygiene kits.  Not even a shower cap.  These are standard now at just about every mid to high-end hotel I've stayed at.     At the time of my stay there is a notice of change of ownership posted in the front. I hope the new ownership pays attention to the smaller details that make the difference to some of the customers

what good is a nice room when your A/C unit sounds like a cheap window unit from the 80s. not only you hear yours, add in the upstairs unit and the one below you and you have a nice loud/distracting sound party.

Summary Heading: Very fine for the right price
Summary: The first thing I should point out is that I got this hotel for $97/night thru Priceline.  That is more than I care to spend for my business trips but it was short notice and i would have had to pay around that price for a lesser hotel.  The room was very clean, and I especially enjoyed the rain shower.  Solid wireless, a nice size working desk, and a Krups coffee set up were all welcome.  Though I never used it, they have a bar and restaurant that seemed inviting.  The location is excellent, close to the 55 and 405 freeways, which was a big plus for me, and I needed and used the airport shuttle.  Every member of the staff was courteous and helpful.  Top marks for that!  Points off for lack of fridge or microwave which I like to have especially on my business trips but also for

We used this hotel for activities in LA, OC and San Diego. Both downtown LA and SD roughly an hour away and beach cities are only a few minutes away. We were pleasantly suprised by this hotel; service was friendly, front desk helpful and location is great (nice shopping mall close by) with plenty of free parking. Our room was a good size, comfy and clean. Bathroom was clean with plenty of towels and everything you might need. My only (a small one) issue was that the AC was too loud. Good value and I shall definitely use this hotel next time I visit Costa Mesa.

We are a family of four (2 teenage daughters) and we really enjoyed our stay. The rooms are nicely decorated. The rainfall shower head makes for a delightful shower. The shampoo, conditioner and lotion was some of the most wonderful products I have used. The fragrance was lovely. Bathrooms are big enough for the morning ritual to fit 2 teenagers + plus mom. Refreshing cucumber water in the lobby added a very nice touch. Quiet rooms:) Only small thing was they should wipe down the bathroom door as it is self closing and was a tad sticky from the inside & the tub didn't drain as well as it should have. Will definitely be back for a stay at this hotel for our Huntington Beach trip next year:)

We used priceline and got this hotel for $85/night, and we were pleased to read the reviews on TripAdvisor, but that is where it stopped.  We arrived at the Hotel, after the check-in time, and we were told our room was not ready.  We waited over an hour and a half, for the room to be ready as they said they had been fully booked the night before (so bring in extra staff to make sure rooms are ready)  First room they put us in looked out over ugly rooftops and wires, not very appealing.  We asked for and they moved us to a "city view" room, which was a better view.  In this room, the air conditioner, never worked properly, you would set it for 65 and in minutes it had reset itself to 72.  When you checked the temperature in the room, it was 78.  When we took showers, (there is no

Summary Heading: Not a bad place for the money.
Summary: Better than most of the low budget hotel cains. Clean and in a good area. Nice pool.   Staff lacked attention to detail and restaurant was unattended at times. Room service was underpar and forgot toast on a breakfast. Not the Ritz but not a filthy chain hotel. I left another hotel during my trip due to lack of cleanliness and bugs so, Hotel Hanford was a pleasant deal for less money.   Comfortable beds with clean bedding. Parking ok, freeway close.

The Hotel Hanford has a lovely lobby and everybody's very nice. But don't get fooled! There's no luggage service, no concierge, the rooms are long and narrow and there's really no room to walk. That said, the beds are good, the shower is wonderful, there's a desk and sitting area (one chair), and the location is within reasonable proximity to Newport Beach without the NB price. The hotel is pet-friendly, but you cannot leave the pet in the room unattended, and there is no pet sitter service although the disclaimer you sign says there is. There's a dog park close by and the dog can go down to the pool with you. McDonald's right next door is a breakfast asset for kids. We did enjoy this hotel; the only complaint was the hot tub was so filthy the one morning we did decide to go use

We stayed with Hotel Hanford for two nights in July 2012 while attending friend's wedding in the area.   Location of the hotel is very convenient. We flew into LAX, which is about 40 minutes away (although the hotel is just minutes away from John Wayne airport). The hotel is pretty easy to find, and it's located right next to South Coast Plaza (great shopping plaza). Many local attractions are also just a short drive away. Our hotel room was very clean and spacious. It's got all the basic amenities (tubed TV, coffee machine and safety box) and free WiFi and ethernet port (with decent connection speed). The room does not come with a fridge though. The staffs were very courteous and welcoming. It was a pleasant experience from the moment we stepped through the front door.  There

Summary Heading: Great value and a good change from national hotel chains
Summary: Booked two rooms for our family of five for three nights.  The price on TravelZoo made it very reasonable.  No charge for parking either; unlike all the other hotels within the area.  Hotel accommodated our request for adjacent rooms to our kids.  Arrived in town earlier than expected and decided to check in.  Only one room was ready, but they gave us the one key and called my mobile as soon as the other room was ready.    Hotel did a very good job in remodeling a dated circa former national hotel chain.  The chic and sophisticated interior definitely is not reflective of the unassuming exterior, but I guess you have to work within your budget constraints.  Compact pool area was better than expected and smartly laid out to allow separate areas for adults in the cabana and

Arrived late and had to leave early so I didn't have the full experience, but I can tell you it had the most comfortable bed I have had in a hotel.  The room was clean.  The shower was good--one of those rain shower heads.  There were only two issues.  The in-room coffee maker is one of those Krups one cup numbers.  Unfortunately, the choice of coffee--not the tastiest for someone used to Peets . (And there are so many single cup options! )  Also, late on a Sunday night, there doesn't seem to be enough staff.  I asked for extra shampoo and never received it.  The front desk staff was friendly.  I'd recommend the place.  The basics are good.  Clean.  Good shower.  Great bed.  Yes, try it. However,  if you're picky about coffee, bring your own.

My girlfriend and I went to see a concert at the Segerstrom Concert Hall. The Hanford offered a perfect location and a free shuttle to and from the concert hall, which was great considering there are several events going on at one time causing parking to be a bit stressful. The Hotel is modern and beautifully decorated inside. The exterior does not do it justice. The rooms are nicely decorated and comfortable beds. Parking is free, which is another plus considering other hotels charge for parking. We were able to easily travel to Newport  Beach, Balboa Island, Laguna Beach and also visited the San Juan Capistrano Mission during our stay. The front desk and bar staff are very nice and helpful.

Summary Heading: Great airport area hotel that exceeded my expectations
Summary: I pricelined a hotel for one night near the airport for $70 and got The Hotel Hanford.  I was very pleasantly surprised with the decor, cleanliness, and room amenities including nice flat screen, quality bedding, and an awesome shower.  I couldnt have asked for more at this price and location

I stayed here for one week on a business trip in early June.  The bed was comfortable, the toiletries and shower were great, and overall the room was very comfortable.  My only complaint is that the only closet space was an armoir that was not very big and totally blocked one side of the bed.  It just seemed out of place and took up awkward space in the room.  Otherwise, the room and the staff there was super nice, adn I would definitely stay there again. Oh, and though this hotel was near the airport, I didn't hear one airplane.  I guess the noise ordinance there works!

Summary Heading: Tries to look nice, but the details are very poor
Summary: I decide to try this property since I stay in the area alot. It is in a convenient location and looks well kept up from the street. However, once i got inside the high quality image fell apart. In my first room, the window AC unit (yes it is a window unit) was so loud I could not hear the TV. The engineer came up quickly to fix it, and was very nice and responsive. After taking it all apart and fixing it, he said this unit is just so old, there is not a lot I can do, then the jet engine noise started again. So I switched rooms, which they handled quickly and expediantly. I got to the new room, and it was much quieter, however there was sand in the bathtub, and only 1 towel in the bathroom. Finally, my 7 am wake up call came at  3 am instead of at 7. Overall, not a good
Manager Response: We would like to extend our apologies regarding this experience and want you to know this is not the level of service we strive for at The Hotel Hanford.
