We appreciate you taking the time to bring these issues to our attention and will look into the practices of housekeeping regarding the lack of towels and sand in the bathroom. Again, we appreciate you bringing this to our attention and will work accordingly to ensure it does not happen again.

Summary: We had very enjoyable stay at the Hotel Hanford May 25-26 on an excellent Bloomspot package: for $99/night, we received a $100 gift card for the South Cost Plaza Mall, access to the mall's VIP Lounge (a lot of fun, especially if you frequent the mall and didn't even know it was there!),  and two free cocktails in the Hotel bar for each night we stayed (2). Check-in was a dream, the personable young man was knowledgable about the hotel and the package, answered our questions about room types and locations and helped us select the available room best for us.  At the end of a relatively short second floor hall with convenient access to the ice machine and the outdoors, our room was large and spotless. It had two queen beds, a desk and a small sitting area with a comfy chair and
Manager Response: Thank you for providing such a detailed review of your experience at The Hotel Hanford. We would like to extend our apologies on the Housekeeping mishap and will lookinto what the issue was to ensure it does not happen again. We will also pass along your comments regarding the pillows as we take every review before our executive team. It is pleasing to hear that you enjoyed your stay overall and were able to take advantage of our special South Coast Plaza experience.  We look forward to hosting you again should you be in the area.

Summary Heading: Even better than expected...and we had pretty high expectations
Summary: My wife and I would heartily recommend this hotel to others who are traveling in the Costa Mesa/Irvine area.  The staff was attentive, friendly and seemed truly eager to help.  The lobby is modern and inviting without being pretentious.  The room was large, comfortable and well appointed.   We stayed at 3 hotels on this trip;  all were nice and all were within the same price range, but this hotel will be our first choice next time we return to the area.
Manager Response: What a flattering review, thank you! It is so pleasing to hear that our staff was able to accommodate your needs and we will pass along your compliments of the d√©cor to our decorator, Martha Burke. We appreciate your recommendation and look forward to seeing you again the next you‚Äôre in the area.

Summary: loved my stay here, super hip and upbeat vibe, clean, modern lux feel.  Reminded me of a  W Hotel but without the price.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We could not be happier to hear that you enjoyed your stay enough to write a short review for us. We appreciate you taking the time to post this review and look forward to seeing you again.

Summary Heading: Had a wonderful experience with my stay at Hotel Hanford
Summary: I stayed at the Hotel Hanford last week. I was pleasantly surprised by the service, restaurant, and rooms!  I highly recommend this hotel and would stay their again on my next stay to Orange County!
Manager Response: We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay at The Hotel Hanford enough to recommend it! Thank you for taking the time to leave a review of your experience and we look forward to seeing you on your next visit to the OC area.

Summary: Let me begin and end with the service; it sets this hotel apart from several others because of it's staff who treat guests like they recognize we have a choice and appreciate the fact we chose to stay with them.  The hotel is in a great location with easy access to the 405 & 55 freeways. There are several restaurants and a mall less than 1 mile away. The Newport beach pier is about 6 miles away.  The hotel is nicely decorated and clean throughout. Our king bed room was immaculate and the rain shower head is just awesome. They also have free parking and a free shuttle that takes you anywhere within a 5 mile radius. The one drawback, or so we thought, was the room did not have a refrigerator. We had a couple energy drinks we wanted chilled before we started our journey so we asked
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review! We realize you have many choices when you travel and are so pleased you allowed us the pleasure of hosting you. We appreciate your feedback, love hearing that we were able to assist you and that you were able to take advantage of our central location to everything Orange County has to offer. Again, thank you for choosing The Hotel Hanford and we look forward to having you again.

Summary: I like hip & modern hotels & am 43 & stay in only 4 or 5 star US hotels. I found this hotel on bloomspot.com. for $100/nt 1 King. To my surprise, I think this used to be the old & dingy Holiday Inn. Well, old & dingy The Handford is not! Adorale style the hotel has graduated-- similar to Starwood Brand (Westin, etc.). Very friendly staff & personal touch as to adress me correctly as a "miss", not ma'am!  Comfortable & new beds & down bedding. New furniture & pretty dark  browns & white, with a splash of color added in decorates the rooms. Coffee maker in room, which I love! No balconies though, my only complaint.  Free parking, and a swiming pool & cabannas (decent size, not extrvageant). Room service prices were reasonale - $12 for omlette.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the review! We love hearing that you enjoyed your stay and were able to enjoy the in-room coffee makers and other amenities such as free parking. We appreciate your review of the d√©cor as well and will be sure to pass along your kind words to our designer Martha Burke as she is responsible for the redesign of The Hotel Hanford. Again, all of your feedback is appreciated and we look forward to hosting you again soon.

Summary Heading: Great staff, great amenities, great room, equals excellent
Summary: From the welcome to the facilities to the room, this hotel is attractive, efficient, and comfortable. They are a hotel that understand business travelers and appreciate their needs without taking advantage of them for more money. Many hotels at this star level charge for internet, printing, computer use, and parking. However, this hotel made those amenities included in their rates.  The hotel is attractive with unique furnishings, comfortable beds, and a friendly, helpful staff.  The only downsides I could find were the prices in the restaurant.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to write this review. It is our pleasure to host business travelers and we could not be more pleased to hear that you found our hotel to be so accommodating for your traveling needs. Again, we appreciate your review and look forward to seeing you again should business bring you to the area.

Summary: We just returned from OC and stayed here for the OC Marathon that was yesterday.  We had booked 2 nights because the last thing you really want to do after running 26.2 miles is have to drive through LA back to where we live.  Anyway, the hotel was absolutely fantastic.  We had a couple of glasses of wine at the bar before heading to carb load at Maggiano's.  Our original plan was to leave Monday morning but some unexpected business came up and we had to be back home Monday morning.  So we checked out around 6:00 at night Sunday night fully expecting to pay for the night we were losing by having to leave early.  We were surprised to find out that the hotel would only charge us a half day rate and not the full night we were missing.  I was totally impressed.  Every other time
Manager Response: We‚Äôre so happy that we could provide a comfortable stay during the OC Marathon! It was our pleasure to host you and we are so glad to hear that we were able to accommodate you when your plans changed. We appreciate your recommendation and look forward to seeing you again the next time you‚Äôre in the area!

Summary Heading: Stay here! Don't miss the restaurant.
Summary: This is a renovation/turnover done right.  It is a perfect complement to the fit and feel of the Costa Mesa/South Coast Metro communities. I'm a local and I booked this for a business guest. We spent quite a bit of time on the property and in the room.  The building has a particularly interesting story. As memory serves, the Holiday Inn that was here went bankrupt and the marshall took possession, evicting the owners and, yes it apparently happens, the guests. Flash forward to today's tastefully appointed lobby, rooms and grounds, and the contrast is astounding. The design work is tasteful, and not over-done, radiating  that boutique hotel buzz.  For an active person, it's a stroll to South Coast Plaza, and great theaters and restaurants.  The restaurant has an innovative menu,
Manager Response: Thank you so much for such a stellar review! We could not be more excited to hear that you enjoyed your time at The Hotel Hanford. We have been so pleased with our remodel and it‚Äôs all thanks to Martha Burke, so we will be sure to pass your kind words on to her. Chef David Fune has also recently revamped our menu, so we will be sure to pass along your feedback to him as well. Again, thank you for the review and we'll see you soon!

Summary Heading: The staff was very accommodating and helpful.
Summary: The staff was very accommodating and helpful.  The Hotel is quite close to the 405 and the Costa Mesa Mall. There are several places to eat within a mile or less.   The hotel exterior has the appearance of a one-time office building due to the very dark glass. The lobby although attractive enough has low ceilings and feels a bit like a basement but if they added some large live plants it would probably change the mood for the better. The parking lot is a bit small but we did not have any problems finding a parking space. Hopefully that is always the case. And the parking is free.   Our room was a king spa room on the 5th floor overlooking the pool. I'm not sure what constitutes this to be a "spa" room other than the fact that it has a big shower with a big shower head.  There is
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to leave us a review of your stay at The Hotel Hanford. The detailyou‚Äôve provided is very helpful and we will pass on your suggestions, such as adding more large live plants in the lobby. We could not be more pleased tohave had the opportunity to host you and look forward to the opportunity to do so again.

Summary: I was in Costa Mesa for just a night; had a birthday party and then brunch the next day. The hotel check in took all of 5 minutes and the lady at the front desk was so nice. she told us about all the amenities such as the shuttle, happy hour in the lounge, etc. even though we could not make use of any of them. When we got to our room it was spacious and very nice. We faced Bristol which scared me from a couple other reviews that says it gets noisy but we heard nothing. A/C worked great and the shower was AMAZING!!!!! We also ranked our bed as in the top 3 that we have stayed in, it was so comfortable. I was so happy with my decision to stay here I would not hesitate to book again
Manager Response: Thanks so much for taking the time to leave us a review of your stay at The Hotel Hanford! We are so excited to hear that while your time here was short, you were able to enjoy it and get a comfortable night of sleep in our beds. We appreciate all of your feedback on the room and staff and will pass it along to the rest of the management team. We look forward to seeing you again; perhaps then you‚Äôll have time to take advantage of some of our amenities. ;)

Summary: We got this hotel thru priceline. We picked this area to be close to relatives. This hotel is close to I-5, but we heard no freeway noise in our room. Easy check-in. Nice pool with large jacuzzi spa. Clean, nice rooms, not too fancy but were fine. Helpful staff. The location was great. We plan to stay here again.
Manager Response: So glad you were able to find us via Priceline, Brien! It was our pleasure to host you and we enjoy hearing you were able to take advantage of our pool area. Thanks for leaving a room tip as well- we're so glad to hear that you weren't bothered by noise from the I-405. :) We appreciate your review and look forward to hosting you again should your travels bring you to the area!

Summary: Very clean and nicely decorated hotel. Large well appointed rooms and bathrooms with rain showers.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review! It is pleasing to hear that you enjoyed our rooms and hotel d√©cor during your stay. We look forward to the opportunity of hosting you again!

Summary Heading: Comfortable bed, nice shower and laptop size safe
Summary: My first time staying at the Hanford. Front desk staff was very professional and friendly. Nice size king room overlooking the pool. Very comfortable bed. Modern bathroom with sizable shower (no tub). The in room safe was the largest I had seen and easily fit my laptop. That's all the good news. Unfortunately, the A/C was a very noisy window unit controlled by a wall thermostat that didn't seem to work. The first of two nights, I finally got the fan to turn off (not sure how) and the room was stuffy. The second night, I tried repeatedly to get the fan off but couldn't. It kept resetting back to automatic resulting in a very cold, noisy, windy room. The TV remote was inconsistent, working sometimes and at other times I had to use the on TV buttons to turn it off. The bathroom
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to write about your visit to The Hotel Hanford. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed our staff, your bed and the view during your stay. However, we‚Äôd like to take note of the other things you mentioned about your room. If you are willing, would you mind sending your room number or the name the room was booked under to thehotelhanford@gmail.com? We‚Äôd like to look into the issues you were having with the wall unit, faucet and television. Thank you again for your review; we appreciate you bringing these things to our attention and hope to hear from you soon.

Summary: This is my second visit and my second review for this hotel.  I have had nothing but good things to say about this hotel.  The staff is accommodating, warm & friendly, helpful and always with a smile.  I called to the front desk a few times during my stay and they were always quick to get me the things that I needed including fulling an ice bucket and bringing it to my room.  The GM even stopped to show us were the hot tub was on the first afternoon we were there.   The hotel was clean and the housekeeping staff kept the hotel looking amazing.  And the Keurig single cup coffee maker is a great touch with both tea and coffee selections.  If you are have the chance, get into one of their king spa rooms.  The shower and large enough for 2 (if two of you want to get into the shower
Manager Response: Thanks so much! We really appreciate your kind review! We are so glad you chose The Hotel Hanford again and then took the time to leave a second review of your experience. We look forward to welcoming you back for a third stay sometime soon!

Summary: What a GREAT hotel!  Dollar for dollar, you'll be hard pressed to find a better deal in Costa Mesa.  The shuttle service was enormous to the pleasure of my two week stay with plenty of things to do in within a five mile radius (South Coast Plaza, Santa Ana art community, Irvine Spectrum) to name a few.  Courteous, prompt attention to every detail and SO CLEAN!  The restaurant is a jewel!  DO eat here.  I'm surprised the locals haven't caught on to this one yet....but I'm sure they will soon!  The pool and hot tub area....super nice.  The gym another great ammentiy.  I came out solo to visit my daughter and midway through my oldest came out and joined us.  The hotel staff welcomed all and made us feel right at home.  Within walking distance I enjoyed a nail salon, massage
Manager Response: We cannot express how flattered we are by your review! Thank you for taking the time to leave such kind words on your stay at The Hotel Hanford! It‚Äôs exiting to hear that we were able to accommodate you and that you were able to takeadvantage of our central location in Orange County and complimentary shuttle service . Again, we appreciate your review, as well as your recommendation, and your kind words will be passed along to our senior management.

Summary: The Hotel Hanford was quiet, clean, & the people friendly and helpful.  When we first checked in, our A/C unit was super loud.  We called down and maintenance came-up within 5 minutes.  As it turns out, the unit was unusually loud and they moved us to another room immediately.  McDonalds is walking distance...right next door.   Quick drive to Huntington Beach Pier, South Coast Plaza, & Mitsuwa Marketplace.  The ventilation in the bathroom was on the weak side...we had to wipe down the mirror because it was dripping with water after taking a shower... but the location, price, & cleanliness made up for this minor inconvenience.  We would stay here again!
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to leave us a review of your experience. It is pleasing to hear that you were able to take advantage of our central location to everything Orange County and that we were able to assist you in switching rooms upon arrival. We will look into your comment about the ventilation in the bathrooms and look forward to hosting you again!

Summary: This place is so nice that I almost didn't want to share it with anyone. Brian at the front desk is very professional and suggested great restaurants. Rooms are nicely decorated and clean. The pool was always deserted and quiet! The restaurant was really good as well. Located near the mall.
Manager Response: We are flattered by your kind review! Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.  We will be sure to pass these comments along to both Brian and our senior management. Until next time! :)

Summary: My husband and I stayed here twice in the the span of a few months when they first rennivated and we loved it. This is a very nice and modern hotel. Rooms are kinda small but nice. Beds are super comfy! Hotel staff are very nice and helpful. Gym was not too shabby. Bar was nice but didn't bother eating at their restaurant cause of all the other delicious places nearby.   There is a McDonalds right next door and a mini Japanese Plaza and market about a block away. My husband and I walked to the market's food court to eat everyday of our stay.   West Coast Plaza is a two minute drive and a few miles in the other direction are more "mom and pop" Japanese restaurants (which I love!) Target and Little Saigon are nearby; a close drive.    Highly recommend this hotel and would stay
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the stellar review and recommendation! We appreciate you taking the time to tell us about your experience and love hearing that you enjoyed both of your recent stays. It is our pleasure to provide amenities for our guests, such as the comfortable beds and gym, and we're glad to hear you took advantage of our central Orange County location!  We look forward to hosting you and your husband again.

Summary: Although this was a business trip, the service and amenities made it feel like a vacation.  The facilities were impeccable and the service was personalized.  They provided excellent room service.  The salmon was cooked to perfection.  Later they delivered a beautiful fruit tray and delicious water from Norway.  The entire hotel was beautifully decorated with warm, soothing colors and contemporary, yet comfortable furnishings...  The walk-in glass shower was to die for...with a rain shower head and your could visually see the temperature of the water as you adjusted it...no need to wait for it to warm up.  The pool sported elegant cabanas and a very nice pool.  They also provide a free shuttle in a five mile radius of the hotel.  This not only includes the airport, but various
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review with such great details! Our hotel was recently remodeled by Martha Burke and we‚Äôre glad you enjoyed her work as much as we do. We are also glad to hear that although you traveled on business you were still able to enjoy the pool area and other amenities we offer our guests. It‚Äôs our goal to make every visit feel special regardless of the reason for the stay! We will be sure to pass along your compliments of the salmon to our Executive Chef David Fune as we‚Äôve recently debuted his new menu and he appreciates all guest feedback. We hope to see you again the next time business or pleasure bring you to the area.

Summary Heading: Hotel Hanford at Costa Mesa is great
Summary: My 15 year old daughter and I stayed two nights recently at this Hotel.  She was doing a water polo tournament and I must say I was pleasantly surprised.  It used to be a Holiday Inn but was taken over by Hanford hotels, everything is new.  It was very stylishly decorated and very elegant.  The bathroom shampoo and conditioner was terffic, as the rain shower head.  My daugher was so tired from her games.  I called the Savoy restaraunt and asked if I could order some dinner and pick it up to avoid room services charges, they said absolutely.  The food very good.  The internet connect on Sat. evening was overloaded, it can only accomodate 150, so we had trouble getting on the server with our PC, but somehow our ipad had no problem.  The hotel was also sold out.  Between the Hilton
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide details of your stay at The Hotel Hanford.  It is pleasing to hear that you enjoyed our d√©cor as our decorator, Martha Burke, worked very hard on this remodel. Along with the new look there was also a new menu released by Executive Chef David Fune, so we will be sure to pass along your stellar review of your meals. It‚Äôs wonderful to hear that you were able to take advantage of our amenities, such as free parking and wifi, and it was our pleasure to host you and your daughter during her tournament. We look forward to seeing you again for the next one!

Summary: I stayed here for business travel at the end of February and booked this hotel on Priceline. Great location for this hotel near South Coast Plaza and John Wayne Airport. The hotel is super clean and loved the newly remodeled decor. The rooms were nicely appointed and the rain shower was a treat. The staff was very friendly and helpful, as well. I did not notice the road noise during the night even though my room faced the street.  The workout room was also clean and had good equipment. I would only suggest some sanitizing wipes to clean the equipment before and after use.  All in all, I would stay here again and would recommend to friends.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review of your experience at The Hotel Hanford. We value your feedback and love hearing that you enjoyed your stay. Your suggestion for adding sanitary wipes in the gym is appreciated and we'll looking into this option. It is always a pleasure to host business travelers and we hope to have the opportunity again should your travels bring you to the area.

Summary: Well situated hotel.  Liked the decor and room furnishings.  Only complaint was that the rain shower didn't work properly and the handheld shower head leaked.  Consequently, there was no way to avoid water on the floor.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave your review, Catherine. We appreciate the feedback and will be sure to pass along your kind words on the d√©cor to Martha Burke who is responsible for our recent remodel. We‚Äôd like to address the shower issue you mentioned in your review. We would appreciate it if you would kindly send us an email to thehotelhanford@gmail.com with any information we can use to identify the room (room number, the name in which your reservation was made) so we can take care of any problems. Thank you again and we hope to have the pleasure of hosting you again soon.

Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Hanford for 1 night with our toddler. Customer Service was good, room was nice. The hotel has been redone and they didn't match the decor too good but overall the stay was nice. I would not recommend eating at the restaraunt becuase the food is not what you pay for. So many places in the area I would just try those out. Location was good...close to freeways and shopping.
Manager Response: It was our pleasure to be able to host you and your family at The Hotel Hanford. Your feedback is valued and we appreciate the time you took to write this review.Would you be so kind as to elaborate on your dining experience in Savoy by sending us an email to thehotelhanford@gmail.com? As we said, you‚Äôre feedback is important to us and we would like to have a better understanding of your experience. We hope to have the pleasure of hosting you and your family the next time you are in the area.

Summary: This was a great hotel.  Very close to the Santa Ana John Wayne Airport.  The rooms were really clean!  The bathroom was a perfect size, although when I got out of the shower everyday there was a huge puddle on the floor from the shower leaking.  Great Rainhead Shower.  If your room is facing the expressway, it can be a bit noisy.  Also, my air conditioning unit woke me up two nights in a row around 6 am.  I turned it off the rest of my stay there, which was for 8 days.  The Inroom Safe was Perfect!  Great for jewelry, laptop, Bose headsets, fits alot.  The front desk staff were all really nice and helpful when needed.  My TV was not working and when I called the front desk the service tech on duty that night fixed it right away.  Loved that this hotel was free parking and wifi.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post this review! We‚Äôre so pleased to hear that you were able to take advantage of our guest amenities. The detail you‚Äôve provided in your review is valued and we appreciate your feedback on the AC unit and shower. Would you be so kind as to send your name or room number to thehotelhanford@gmail.com so we can check on that shower leak? It was our pleasure to host you at our hotel and we hope to see you the next time your travels being you to the area. Also, be sure to visit our website to sign up for our emails in order to keep an eye out for those specials.

Summary: This used to be a HI, but wallpaper, paint, new furniture, new baths (incl. Grohe fixtures) and a spruced up outside hide it well. The rooms are big and well furnished, the small bathroom is a treat and the service at reception is immaculate. The rooms AC is from the 80s (70s?) and the noise from traffic on Bristol is noticeable, if not disturbing, if your room is facing that way. I priceline'd this for $100 and think that is a sweet deal for Costa Mesa.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post this review. The experiences of our guests are important to us and we love hearing feedback. Your kind words on our remodel are appreciated and we‚Äôll be sure to pass them on to Martha Burke who was responsible for the boutique experience you see today. We are glad to hear that you were able to experience our hotel through your Priceline booking and we look forward to hosting you again should your travels bring you to the OC area.

Summary: We had a great time at The Hanford. Rooms very big and so is the bathroom. Location was close to the mall. The hotel shuttle is also very convenient way to the airport. There are a few good restaurants within walking distance (Oki doki and anjin). The Mitsuwa market place is also within walking distance. If you need to heat up something, theres a microwave near the vendo machines. I also read some reviews that said rooms facing the freeway was noisy but it wasn't in our case. My only complain was that there was no coin laundry.
Manager Response: We appreciate the time you took to write this review, thank you! It‚Äôs such a treat to hear that you were able to take advantage of our central location and amenities. Perhaps the next time your travels bring you to the area you can check out our Valet Laundry Service to take care of all of your laundry needs. Again, we appreciate the time you took in writing this review and hope to see you again soon.

Summary: I had traveled quite frequently to the area for work in the past, and remember when this old Holiday Inn was being remodeled into what is now a sleek and modern hotel. What a fabulous job! The hotel entrance and lobby is grand and welcoming, and all the decor and furnishings are tastefully done and of great quality. I never would have guessed the hotel was a Holiday Inn in its past life.   I stayed at the hotel after finding a great deal online. Aside from online deals, the hotel is a great value itself - costing less than other hotels in the area, with free internet and parking. The beds are comfortable, the rooms are spacious, and the bathrooms are beautifully done, complete with a rain shower. My only complaint is that the heating/air unit is a bit noisy, and I could hear
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review, Jae. We love hearing that you enjoyed your stay as well as the hotel d√©cor. Martha Burke did the decor remodel and we will be sure to pass along your kind words. Your feedback on the remaining aspects of your stay is appreciated and will be passed along to the appropriate management. It was our pleasure to host you during your travels and we hope to have the opportunity to do so again soon!

Summary: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights. (Dec 31 2011-Jan 2 2012) We had such a wonderful time there. The staff is polite and eager to help in any way, all except one of the bartenders. He was so rude we didn't even bother learning his name. Tho he did ruin my night the rest of our stay was so amazing. The bathrooms alone are worth the room price. We enjoyed the sleek, simple furniture and the comfort of the bed. The room we had was a bit small but its so well designed that it doesn't bother you at all. We left talking about wanting to go back. They will definitively see our business again.
Manager Response: Ana, it was our pleasure to host you and your husband as you rang in the New Year. It's wonderful to hear that you enjoyed the hotel d√©cor and were able to indulge in our bathrooms. We would like to apologize for your experience with one of our bartenders. If you remember his name or anything else you‚Äôd like to bring to our attention please email us at thehotelhanford@gmail.com as we would like to respond to this experience appropriately and somehow remedy the encounter. Thank you for making us part of your New Year‚Äôs experience. We truly look forward to seeing you again!

Summary Heading: Fabulous hotel next to South Coast Plaza
Summary: We moved from the Hilton across the street mainly for the free parking, but were so pleased we did.  The hotel itself is much nicer, with all the modern conveniences built in.  We asked for a quiet room away from Bristol street as it can get quite noisy, and were well takencare of by Alex at the front desk.  We also had dinner in The Savoy dining room which was wonderful.  Anna seved our drinks & popcorn with paprika in the bar with drinks and it was fabulous! We will definitely stay here on our next trip.   Our only complaint was that the pillow were too "big".  They were just too uncomfortable for us but we didn't complain as everything else was great!
Manager Response: Stephani, thank you for making the switch to The Hotel Hanford. We are so pleased to hear that Alex was able to take care of you. Your compliments on the hotel‚Äôs d√©cor as well as the review of your Savoy experience are appreciated and your kind words will be passed along to Anna. Please know we appreciated the time you took to write a review. We look forward to hosting you the next time you‚Äôre in the area!

Summary: We travel a ton for hockey.  The Hanford is by far the nicest hotel we have ever stayed in!  We are definitely going back!

I stayed for 3 nights and was very very pleased. Every staff member was friendly and genuinely intent on providing exceptional service.  The room was quiet abd well appointed.  The shower was amazing.  Room service was food quality was adequate esp. since it was well-priced for a hotel where the prices are usually exorbadent.  Free parking is a HUGE perk.  I hope to stay there again.
Manager Response: It‚Äôs great to hear you had such a fantastic stay at The Hotel Hanford and were able to enjoy all our amenities like that of our free parking and dining services. We actually just recently rolled out a new menu produced by our Executive Chef, Chef David Fune. There has been such great feedback, so we are excited to hear you enjoyed everything as well.  Moreover, please know we truly appreciate the time you took to post a review. Here‚Äôs to welcoming you back in 2012! Happy New Year!

Summary: I recently stayed at the Hotel Hanford using my Living Social Coupon I purchased at the beginning of the year.  The rooms were clean however we had complain about our first room.  It completely wreaked of cigarettes but Brian, front desk clerk, changed my room immediately.  For a remodeled Holiday Inn, this was a nicely renovated hotel.  I loved the rain shower!!  My only complaint was the waitress that worked in the Savoy restaurant on site.  She is EXTREMELY SLOW so if you don't have 1.5 hours for breakfast you're better off eating somewhere else.  Other than that I enjoyed my stay!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review as it‚Äôs such a delight to know that you were able to take advantage of our Living Social deal. It also pleases us to hear that Brian was able to be so accommodating in regards to your room change--we‚Äôll be sure to let him know about your kind words. Please know your evaluation is held in high accord and will be passed on to the proper individuals. Again, thank you. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back to our hotel sometime soon. Happy Holidays!

Summary Heading: Only stayed one night, but it was a good experience
Summary: I'm only basing this review on a one-night stay, but I'd still say is a good hotel.  My friends threw a holiday party in one of the party rooms so we booked a hotel room here so we could easily crash afterwards.  The service is very nice and friendly.  The room is well appointed and clean and very modern.  Really my only complaint is the one shared by other reviewers of this property... the A/C unit is WAY too loud!  This seems to be the one thing leftover from the previous hotel (my guess).    Although it was December and we normally wouldn't run the A/C, we tried to keep it on just the fan in order to keep air circulating and still found it to be insanely loud.  Our saving grace was that we were able to open the window just a crack.  At least we were able to have SOME air
Manager Response: We are so pleased that The Hotel Hanford was able to assist you by providing a comfortable place to stay after your friend‚Äôs party! It pleases us to hear that you found the room‚Äôs modern theme appealing and well appointed. The honesty you‚Äôve provided in your feedback about the A/C units is appreciated and we‚Äôll be sure to pass it along, as well as your comment about the shower drain. Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your experience as well as the recommendation to future travelers. Again, your feedback is appreciated and we hope to have the pleasure of seeing you again soon. Happy Holidays!

Summary: This isn't a plush, over-the-top, luxury hotel.  But if you want a decently furnished, clean, comfortable room, go here.  And if you want to avoid paying ridiculous parking fees, like at the other hotels nearby, go here.  The shower is awesome with a huge rain shower head and PARKING IS FREE!!!.  The only downside is the street noise if your room is facing out to the freeways.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience at The Hotel Hanford. It is our pleasure to provide such amentities as free parking and relaxing bathroom options for our guests and are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed them while traveling on business.  Should you have the opportunity to come back to The Hotel Hanford, please let me know we I can personally assist you in arranging a more quiet room. Warm Regards,

Summary: Got reservations one day in advance.. and my first priceline bid was $45.00. Room and interior  of hotels is very nice. I was expecting  to bid higher  but got on the first bid. Reportedly this is a remodeled Holiday Inn. Check in staff terrific, spacious room with pool view, neat shower with a hand held and a Rain shower head about 9 feet tall. Soft bed, desk, easy chair and even soft padding under the carpet. Room service breakfast timely and very economical compared to most room service. Hotel was quiet... the pool was huge but we were too bussy.... it appears to be heated as there were several swimmer there well after sunset.  a k-cup coffee maker. robes.large bathroom with that large spa shower. . These kind of amenities make me wish i could choose the hotel , but at least
Manager Response: Hi Patsy. We can't thank you enough for the compliments and feedback you have shared about your experiences at The Hotel Hanford. We are glad that the Priceline bidding process offered you the opportunity to experience The Hotel Hanford.  Moreover, we appreciate your glowing remarks about the front desk team and will be sure to share this review with them. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back soon...maybe you could even try out our pool! Again, thank you.

Summary: I stay at the Hotel Hanford frequently and enjoy my experience everytime. The front desk staff is friendly and welcoming. I appreciate that they remember me by name. The restaurant staff is equally awesome! I typically will sit at the bar and enjoy a glass of wine to wind down from my day. The food is always great and I really like the new menu options. Anytime I know a work collegue is travelling in the area, I always recommend the Hotel Hanford because I know they will be treated as family and find comfort with the accomodations. Keep up the excellent work!
Manager Response: Dana, I cannot tell you how much we appreciate you taking the time to share your experience as one of our most loyal guests. It is especially kind of you to note our new menu options at Savoy as we're very proud of the changes. I will make sure and send the front desk staff and Chef David your kind compliments! Moreover, thank you for referring your colleagues to our property. We truly look forward to having you back for another relaxing glass of wine at Savoy and stay at The Hotel Hanford.

Summary: All I can say is WOW!  My husband and I stayed for a weekend (fri-mon) and had such a memorable experience.  From beginning to end, the service was far above what anyone can ask for.  The clerks were fantastic!  EVERYONE we came in contact with there at the hotel was friendly, always offering to assit in anyway and asking how we were doing.  Even the room service was good.  The room was comfortable and very clean. Loved the shower!  The resturant/lounge had great food and service. Fitness center had just enough of everything for my husband. :)  Location was great.  Everything we needed in Costa Mesa was down the street from the hotel.  The service provided by the people who were working there made our trip more worth it than anything else.  Thank you for all for everything!  We
Manager Response: You're welcome. Thank you so much for taking the time to write The Hotel Hanford such a  great review as we love hearing about our guests' experiences. Moreover, we appreciate  your kind words about our staff and will make sure to share the review with them. We look  forward to seeing you and your husband again soon!

Summary Heading: After trying several hotels in the area of john wayne airport is a gem. 5 star comfort at 3 star prices.
Summary: Not much more to say then the subject line. Will return!
Manager Response: Thanks for posting your 5-star review! We love being called a "gem" as we truly strive to be a unique and comfortable destination for our guests and travelers. Again, we're delighted that you enjoyed your stay with us and hope we will have the pleasure of serving you in the near future. Kind regards.

Summary: This hotel is basically a wannabe night club. The music was blasting so loud, the walls in our room were shaking. According to the front desk, this is exactly what the DJ was paid to do. We had to check out in the middle of the night and relocate to another hotel. To add insult to injury, the night before, there was ALSO a lot of noise with a group of drunk people yelling outside our window. If you want to get a good night's rest after a long drive/flight or a day at Disney, this is definitely NOT the place for it. If you want to party all night long, then you would probably enjoy this place. It's also next to a freeway so be ye warned.
Manager Response: We truly want to apologize for your experience at The Hotel Hanford and thank you for your review as it allows us to make changes to our everyday operations. We're dedicated in trying to improve our service and feedback like yours makes this possible. In hopes of being able to remedy this situation, could you email The Hotel Hanford at  thehotelhanford@gmail.com and provide your name and phone number? We'd love to contact you directly by phone. Again, we're very sorry for your experience and truly look forward to hearing from you.

Summary: Great little hotel with nice modern decor, interesting room service menu and good service all for very reasonable rates.
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear you enjoyed our new decor, menu, rates and service! Come visit us again soon!

Summary: The hotel is decent but make certain you have all your property because their housekeeping staff will NOT turn it in.  Then the hotel will not acknowledge it at all, they will simply repeat over and over to you that they have never had anything stolen from their hotel by their staff.  In the end they even refused to make note of the fact that our property was missing to help future travelers avoid the problem or at least find and release the employee that decided to keep our property.  This is not a company that believes the customer is always right, rather, the customer is somehow wrong because lost property has never been a problem in their hotel, except of course with us and probably other people who negligently left anything behind.
Manager Response: All of us at The Hotel Hanford want to ensure our valued guests that we take the security of our guests belongings very seriously.  We have a state of the art lock system and we offer in-room safes for the guests to secure their more valuable items.   If there is ever an instance where an item is believed to be missing, we do everything possible to locate the item.  Our trusted and valued employees have demonstrated time and time again that they follow our lost and found procedures and we frequently ship items back to our guests that have been left behind.   Thank you for continuing to make The Hotel Hanford your choice when visiting Costa Mesa.

Summary: Great hotel, for being the new player on the block.  It's trendy and has the look of sophistication.  Seems like it's for the "new businessperson", late 20s to 30s, looking for something not built for children, and lacks the corporate feel.  Though it lacks things like in-room amenities of a coffee maker and bottled water, it has a decent pool and hot tub, a nice restaurant and bar area (great wine flights), and a 24-hour gym.  Another thing that isn't so great is that it uses the old-school A/C units, so they are noisy at times.  I really like the decor throughout the hotel - very chic.  Also the card keys are sensored, not swiped here.  Super-close access to 405/55/73 freeways, beach, malls, and restaurants (and a free shuttle for a close radius).  Also, parking is free!  Now,
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review for The Hotel Hanford! We are glad you enjoyed your stay with us. We will pass along all your suggestions to our management team as we truly value the opinion of our guests. Come back and see us again soon!

Summary: I like the location as it was right off the freeway.  And the great shopping of Orange County within a 5 minute drive.  But the property itself is a bit strange.  The design and decor are very hip.  But the public areas (pool, workout area) felt very much like its old Holiday Inn history.  It sorta feels like a wanna be W Hotel...which is clearly isn't.
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting The Hotel Hanford and taking the time to leave a review.  We truly value your feedback and continue to work on all of the little touches we feel make the property stand out.  We hope you‚Äôll come back and visit us again soon.

Summary: Hotel staff bend over backwards to accomodate your every need. Very comfortable beds. Super quiet - only a mile from the airport. Need coffee setup in rooms. Also a hotel van that will take you where ever you want to go within a 5 mile radius.
Manager Response: We're so glad that we were able to accommodate you and that you enjoyed your trip! Please, come back and visit in the future! We look forward to having you. :)

Summary: Excellent service, clean rooms, nice pool. Gym had all needed equpment for a good workout. I would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review! So glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay and that our gym provided everything needed for your workout!

Summary Heading: Holiday inn in a cuter outift
Summary: Well done b still can see remnants of the prior hotel (motel) chain. Notably the loud ac in the room.   Otherwise terrific.
This was a very nice location, next to freeway ramp; nice staff, great service.  I would stay here again if need to be in the area.  No complaints.  No view.  McDonalds next door.

Summary Heading: Hidden little secret of Costa Mesa.
Summary: Shhh. Don't tell anyone but locals. Incredible new management, this place is changing quick and will be the next W of Orange County. New menu coming and djs wow music to my ears.
Absolutely fantastic. Affordable, modern, quiet, and clean. Great beds. Nice size rooms. Great central location.  Free parking!  We would definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: Not what I had hoped for.....
Summary: Was a little hesitant to stay after surveying some of the comments on trip advisor, but booked on a last minute trip. Wish I had more time to find another hotel. Checked in at 2:00 and was told room was being cleaned and would be ready in an hour and a half. Went back three hours later still no rooms available. Front manager had attitude and said previous clerks were basically "misinformed." He wouldn't tell me how much longer, since apparently I was being misinformed from all of their staff. WOW. Nice touch. Throw your co-workers under the bus....needless to say, we made the best of it, i.e. spent a lot of time away from the hotel.....crappy wifi, very limited parking but at least hotel is close to shopping and restaurants. Won't stay here again.

I stayed at this hotel for two months from June 2010- August 2010 for Management training ! It was absolutely Relaxing and Professional. Even though it was a business trip, this hotel has many amnenties to help relieve the stress of Business and being away from home. The huge heated pool, hot spa, well euipped fitness center, and delectable restaurant choices made me never want to leave this hotel The restaurant has something for everyone taste; to gourmet burgers and homemade wedge fries to extravagant dishes of seafood, lamb and pasta! They offer complimentary breakfast every morning which made me put on a few pounds. Lol...The staff is absolutely wonderful, very warm and nice. I can honestly say the entire staff became like family while I was there. Even with all the

Very good hotel all around...definitely worth a return stay! If you're accustomed to a 5-star experience however, you may be somewhat disappointed as it doesn't have all the perks you might find in other hotels. HOWEVER, given what it does offer, this hotel is the best bang for your buck [and more!] in the Costa Mesa/Newport area:  PROS: ‚Ä¢ location!!! in the middle of the 405, 55 and 73 fwys, and next to South Coast Plaza, with easy access to Newport beaches and Fashion Island ‚Ä¢ modern glam interiors...kudos to the interior design team...room felt very posh ‚Ä¢ uncrowded swimming pool [possibly because most ppl opt to go to the beach!] ‚Ä¢ quiet rooms [5th floor is the best!] ‚Ä¢ super nice, spa-like shower ‚Ä¢ wonderful linens and bed ‚Ä¢ very attentive staff ‚Ä¢ free, unlimited cold water

Summary Heading: some great things, some not so great...
Summary: My husband and I stayed here before we went to Catalina, out of the Newport Beach port. The staff was very friendly and helpful, they even left the pool and spa open late for us. The rooms were clean and parking was free (the hotel hilton across the street charged for parking.) Its right by a HUGE mall with lots of restraunts, good location and like 20 min from disneyland and 15 min to the beach. At check in we were told the hotel just under went a huge remodel and just recently re -opened. The remodel is nice, but somethings seemed like they just got "dressed up" and not really fixed maybe. We stayed on the 5th floor, when you get off the elevator its like a sauna in the hallway of the rooms, there is no central air conditioning. There is a wall unit air conditioner in the room

My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Hanford for 1 night during a weekend celebration for his birthday.  The staff was very helpful and Matt gave exceptional customer service.  The room was very clean and the bed was delightfully comfortable.  If we are ever in this area again we will not hesitate to stay here.  Thank you Hotel Hanford.

Believe it or not they closed the whole front parking lot and  had everyone cram into a 2 floor parking structure in back so that at the crack of dawn on a Saturday morning they could have a car show in the front of the hotel..The people who brought their cars were local guys, they weren't even guests of the hotel..They raced their engines, tooted their horns, played loud music right in front of the hotel rooms...when I complained to the OWNERS of the hotel, they could have cared less. Lost my business, and I hope you make sure they dont have anything like this planned if you plan to stay here...
Manager Response: Jerestina,   We are so sorry to hear about the trouble with parking. Unfortunately we were hosting an event at the time of your stay, but that should not have interfered with your relaxation or enjoyment. We truly want to apologize for your experience at The Hotel Hanford and thank you for your review. We'd love to remedy this situation immediately. Could you please email us directly at TheHotelHanford@gmail.com? We're looking forward to hearing from you!

Summary Heading: Absolutely amazing is all I can say! Not one complaint
Summary: Service: The best!   Every hotel staff member we ran into had a smile and truely seemed to enjoy their job. From the moment we entered the lobby and were greated by the staff unitl we left.  We where in town for the OC Fair and Bob Dylan concert.  The hotel provided a free shuttle to the concert as well as a phone number to call when we needed a ride back.  During breakfast I mentioned to one of the staff we wanted to go to a beach inthe area, he provided us with printed directions to local beaches.  Just the little things like this made the stay very nice.  HOTEL OVERALL: Beautiful, comfortable, plenty of space, excellent customer service, top notch drinks (and plenty of them), always someone ready to take our orders, great selecion of great food, first class all the way!  We

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, very helpfyl front desk
Summary: Clean, nice hotel. Front desk very helpful. Walking distance to mall. Hotel provides free shuttle to John Wayne airport where you can rent cars. WiFi was not great - cut out often. When this was pointed out, front desk suggested that I use WiFi in the lobby! Not the kind of response you would expect from a hotel catering to businesses.

This was a last choice (due to other travelers' negative reviews), as all hotels in the area were full. Although the lobby has been updated, and rooms are ok but nothing special, the bathrooms are low-end. In the old, high-rise section (king spa rooms), the "spa" bath is a dark, small space with a plastic shower floor (looks like they took out a bathtub and sealed the floor space).   The overhead rainfall shower head does not work. Others have made the same observation, so it wasn't just my shower. There's a tiny handheld shower head, but the water pressure isn't sufficient to rinse one's hair, and it is positioned so the sharp metal soap dish pushes into your neck if you try to stand under the shower. The flooring is dark brown something (vinyl?). The shampoos are in paper

We have enjoyed staying at the Hotel Hanford two different times in 2011. Beautifully decorated rooms, quiet, fabulous shower - wonderful restaurant and bar area where you can just go sit and relax and eat appetizers.  The customer service is #1 to them.  Very nice, warm and welcoming personnel. We'll stay at the Hotel Hanford anytime we are in that area of Orange County, CA.

Summary Heading: My new favorite place to stay in OC
Summary: I won't reiterate all the many positive things other reviewers have already said - (they are ALL true!). The room decor is unique and beautiful, in a subtle way that you cannot see in the internet photos. I loved the olive green velvet chair, the bed frame which was entirely enveloped in a golden bronze faux leather (i.e. plastic, which I liked because it looked upscale, yet is very cleanable.) The desk chair was super comfy, and there was even a huge ottoman for extra seating should you have an impromptu party. The pool is very large (one can actually do laps!) and they provide tons of chaise lounges, chairs, and four cabanas, all surrounded by palms and grass. Yes, it is too bad the pool is abutting a neighborhood, the closest home hosting a loud kiddie party in their

My husband and I recently spent 5 days at the Hotel Hanford.  We realized, when we pulled up, that we had stayed there once years ago with our sons, when it was a Holiday Inn.  We were pleasantly suprised by the changes that have taken place to the hotel.  The lobby and rooms are very nice, contemporary, yet warm and inviting in an upscale way.  We chose the hotel for their location to everything we wanted to do while there in SoCal, Disneyland, beach, shopping at SCPlaza etc....We had a great time.  The room was clean, quiet, despite facing Bristol and being so near the 405.  The bed would have been more comfortable with a memory foam mattress pad or something, as it was very firm and not so easy on the joints.  However the extra touches like the rain shower head in the

Summary Heading: Waited 2 hours for our room and got a downgrade.
Summary: We arrived from Phoenix at 3pm for checkin. They told us our room was not ready and it would be available in 30 minutes. 2 hours later, we were given a downgraded room. While we were waiting (very patiently I might add) they offered three other guests a different room and wine. Never were we offered this. Then they kept asking us fo our name. We gave it to them 3 times...and we did not leave the lobby. Finally, we had to ask for another room and were not even offered the wine, we had to say we overheard then offer it to everyone. So we got a cheap bottle of wine and smaller room after waiting 2 hours. Thanks Hanford.

Check in is pleasant and efficient.  We learned there is a $50 fee for hotel incidentals, but the $50 is refundable if not used.  There is free self parking (no valet).  That is a bonus in this area.  Adjacent hotels charge $12-24 per day for parking.  A bellman did not greet us as we gathered our luggage from the reserved ‚ÄúRegistration‚Äù area, but bellmen are present in the hotel.  Pets are allowed in certain room areas with a $50 non-refundable fee.  Although the hotel is literally right on OC‚Äôs 405 freeway, we heard did not hear any noise.  Rooms facing the street (or even numbers) may experience some freeway noise.  The pool area is lush California green with ferns, agapanthus and grass.    There is both a pool and plaster, in-the-ground hot tub.  The pool has ample umbrellas

This was by far the nicest, most beautiful hotel I've ever had the pleasure of staying at. It was SO clean & I am very nit picky about cleanliness. The staff was more than helpful and very welcoming. We were with a wedding party & got a wonderful price for our room also. Loved it!

My husband and I went on a one-night staycation at The Hotel Hanford.  There was a special deal through Living Social for $109 that included a one-night stay, free breakfast, coupons for South Coast Plaza, and a card allowing us to go to Access Lounge (the VIP lounge in South Coast Plaza).  The rooms are wonderfully updated!  We almost felt like we were in a luxury hotel!  The front desk receptionists were professional and friendly.  The wi-fi internet access was very spotty, though.  You get online, then everything stops after 3 minutes.  It might start working again 5 minutes later.  Our breakfast at the restaurant downstairs consisted of a nice buffet breakfast that included the usual: scrambled eggs, pancakes, potatoes, bacon, fresh fruit, and biscuits, mini-croissants, and

This is the best hotel that I have stayed at in the Orange County/Costa Mesa Area.  The room was very well appointed, clean and comfortable.  I loved the walk in shower with the amazing rainwater shower head.  The staff was amazingly helpful both on facebook and via email.  The room was very quiet as well.  The staff honored all my request.  My only disappoint was that there was a charge for use of the business center, 5 bucks for 15 minutes of internet use.  There was a 50 cent charge for printing just one black and white page from the word processor that I got charged for 3 times but only got one page.

Summary Heading: The staff is The Hotel Hanford's best asset.
Summary: What I liked best:  Every employee we encountered during our four-night stay was friendly and helpful.  Clean room with tasteful decor Convenient location, close to main streets, mall, restaurants Free parking in front of the hotel Clean room   Beds and linens were very comfortable. Good shower Room service breakfasts were delicious. Van and driver service Clean room  What I liked least:   Stained carpeting in the 2nd floor hallway outside our room  Overall, this was a great place to stay and I would stay here again!

Stayed here for 2 nights as I needed to be close to some friends in the O.C and loved this hotel. This used to be a Holiday Inn but you would not know it looking at the new exterior and refurbished interiors. The lobby is stylish and the dayshift girl on the front desk is very friendly and helpful during my stay across the 3 days.  My room was in the south tower which is called the executive side and the rooms were great. Large, clean with an additional sofa, coffee table and full size desk. This room would be perfect for someone who needed to do some work during their stay and with the included wi-fi this is more than possible. This hotel also gives free parking and has a shuttle to the nearby OC airport.   The Hanford is extremely convenient as it is just off the 405 freeway

I've stayed here for business several times and have nothing but nice things to say. Rooms are clean, staff is friendly and the food is excellent! I was pleasantly surprised at the food and wine in the hotel restuarant...very, very good. Try the "olives" as an appetizer!!!!

Summary Heading: Don't think twice.  MUST STAY HERE !  Take it from an expert vacationer
Summary: I've been a fan of other high end hotels but tried the Hanford at the recommendation of a friend who knows my picky taste.  I'm a bit of a vacation snob and love to take miniture pamper me-vacations.  That being said comfort and class are a must.  While the outside of the hotel didn't seem overwhelming, the lobby was surprisingly nice...contemporary and clean lines.  The room (King Superior) was great.  Very modern and clean and roomy.  I loved the sofa in the room because I could relax and watch TV or relax in the bed.  It was apartment cozy.  The bed was wonderful.  I can't imagine staying anywhere else.  Everyone made a good impression.  Rowena was so helpful when I checked in.  Josh and Javier both helpful during reservations and upon arrival.  The free shuttle was

Summary Heading: Worth the money- great place and location
Summary: We found this place online for a good price and never had been to Orange County before, so we went for it not knowing what to expect. When we arrived, the hotel is in such a convenient location- right off the highway. Its also in such a great spot- so close to Newport Beach. There are great bars and restaurants around too- checkout the 'Lab!'  The rooms are all renovated, the shower is awesome and the bed is comfy. Very clean and the service is great. They even have a great restaurant. All in all great place!!

When I saw the Living Social deal I grabbed 2 since we would be in the area for a wedding. With $50 credit at their Savoy Restaurant and Lounge (separate review available) for each night I thought I had purchased the deal of a life time. Yes, it was a good deal, but there was one major setback. First off, yes, the hotel is nicely remodeled. I never saw it prior to its renovation, but the d√©cor now is very modern and clean. The lobby has a comfy lounge area with delicious apples for guests to help themselves.   The front desk staff are very friendly and always offer a smile. The rooms are nicely appointed with the standard bed, flat screen tv, desk, night stands, armoire, and safe. The bathroom had a separate toilet area and offered basic toiletries and a blow dryer. In addition,

Summary Heading: Pretty good price for a pet friendly hotel
Summary: Had a day off on Good Friday.  Decided to take our regular visit to southern Cal.  Since Wyndham on the Avenue of the Arts is no longer pet-friendly, we decided to stay at Hotel Handford, as there's a special on Priceline. We were pleasantly surprised, since the amenities have everything we need.  Wifi and parking are also free, unlike Wyndham. The only thing I wasn't too impressed with is the a/c, which was very loud, but I think that is something I can look pass, since the price was pretty good.

The staff was very friendly and the rooms are amazing! Beds are very comfortable, the pool was very clean and so was the jacuzzi. You seriously cant go wrong here people!!! My girlfriend and I will definatly be staying here again.

Summary Heading: Looking for an excuse to return!
Summary: Great room, fabulous staff, great location, would recommend it to any one without hesitation.  I can truly say that as nice as this hotel is, and it is very nice, the staff really made it outstanding.    One little tiny thing... the sink is very high in the bathroom.  For short folks like me getting ready, i.e.; trying to put on makeup, was difficult.  A wall mounted magnifying mirror in the bathroom would be the cherry on top of the sundae!

This hotel is one of the sweetest surprises I imagine anyone could receive this year.  This boutique hotel has all of the sophistication and added perks travelers like me enjoy and all of the personal touches of a small-town B&B.    I had to be in Costa Mesa for a week, more or less.  No fun, no frills, just work.  Similar to most of us, I imagine, all I wanted was a reasonable rate, a clean room and adequate light at a work space that was not swarmed with branded hotel tchotchkes.   This hotel seemed to fit those requirements, but it is vastly more than that.  - The lobby has a very open, welcome feel.  The coffee they provide gratis in the lobby every morning is key.    - The rooms are very efficient -  I'd call it a Miami Art Deco decor that is very simplistic, but elegant.

This place was really great.  The restaurant has incredible food if you just want to check it out and is actually really well priced.  We stayed here on a Living Social deal as well, and had a 2 night stay, which included 2 $50 vouchers to the restaurant.  It took 3 meals to use all $100, even having apps and Filet Mignon!  But honestly, the best part was the staff.  They were so accommodating and friendly.  They offer a shuttle to take guests within 5 miles and will come pick you up also.  It is such a nice touch and Greg was so helpful-even getting together a list of suggestions for activities for us! The rooms were spacious and had nice add-ons like the rain shower head with the wand feature, and the sitting area with a pull-out queen.  A small fridge would have been really

My wife and I also found this hotel on Living Social and took advantage of the deal, but it worked like a charm because we will definitely by back to this location.  As everyone has said the staff is the best.  Very pleasant check in, we requested another robe and it was there in less than 10 minutes.  We had a King with a very nice sitting area.  The pool area is very nice and clean.  Free Parking!! Go over the Freeway to the Westin and you pay $25 a night to park your car!  Which on a personal rant, the corporate shmuch who came up with this idea should be shot. The bed was great, we both slept very well. As for the two comments I've read about no refrigerators or coffee in the room.  I do agree, those would be nice touches, at least the coffee, but there is plenty of free

Summary Heading: Great value, pleasant surroundings and amazing staff.
Summary: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. We stayed there because of the location being so close to the orange county performing arts center. Little did we know that the rooms would be so nice, the food so amazing and the staff so awesome. They went above and beyond to make our weekend in costa Mesa extremely enjoyable and carefree.

Summary Heading: Lovely rooms, fantastic staff, great value for money - a real find.
Summary: I arrived after 24 hours travel to a warm welcome.  The hotel has been recently renovated, and the rooms are spacious and very comfortable.  The pool area is lovely and appears to be very child friendly, too.   I had emailed before my arrival to find out if I could arrange some horse back riding during my stay, and Edward was very helpful in locating stables around 30 minutes away.  On my arrival, an envelope had been left for me from Joshua, with further details of stables he had gone to the trouble of finding that would allow me to make use of the hotel shuttle for transport.  A really nice touch, and very kind of the staff.   I must make mention of the shuttle service, which was invaluable to me.  I did not want to hire a car for my short visit, and the shuttle was made

Matt and Cameron greeted us a warm smile and sincere welcome. It was a welcome we needed after a long flight and dealing with rude fellow passengers. The room was spacious and the bed was so comfy it has spoiled me. The entire room was clean. The shower has a rainshower head, in which I didn't want to get out. Which we could have stayed longer. There's free starbucks coffee in the lobby. When the creamer pot was empty, Matt ran and got more without hesitation. They gave us suggestions on where to have breakfast and printed us directions. We usually stay at chain hotels, but will definitley stay here again.

Summary Heading: One Night in Costa Mesa, CA
Summary: We called to check on availability for a  night's stay, saw it on Living Social.  Matt let us know they had a room, but that the coupon could take up to 48 hours, but they had a room for only $99 with two queen beds!   He politely took our information and we received an email confirmation in a matter of minutes!  Thanks Matt for the heads up on the coupon!  We got to the Hotel Hanford and were checked in by Jennifer R.  She was friendly and professional. She asked about our trip to determine our needs.  We were leaving for a Disney Cruise the next day and got directions to the port.  She also asked if we had eaten dinner yet, Savory, their restaurant was open until 10 pm.  It smelled wonderful, but we had already eaten.  Our room had a really nice bathroom with a rainwater

I have stayed here about once a month for business meetings for several years so have seen the whole transition from Holiday Inn to Hotel Hanford. I think they did a great job updating the rooms with a trendy decor and making the hotel look sleek and modern. The rooms are very nicely appointed and I like the scent of the toiletries they provide. Free WiFi is always a plus as is the free parking. I would agree with other reviewers that they could have left the in room coffee maker, but I usually order a room service breakfast anyway so it's not that big of a deal. If you have any objection to room service prices, McDonalds is right next door. The staff here has always been top notch, friendly and helpful. I have stayed at all of the other hotels in the immediate area, the Hilton

You would never think Holiday Inn when you arrive.  I arrived early around noon and checked in.  The lobby was really nice, stylish.  The man at the front desk was really nice and got me a room right away.  It was on the 3rd floor and I asked if they had anything on a higher floor.  He said no, they were still cleaning out rooms from the previous evening.  He calls someone to come get my luggage from the car and while we are out there a room became available.  As I walk back in he hands me new keys to my room on the 5th floor :).  The maintenance man had gone ahead of me as I was getting little personal items out of the car, so he called him and had him meet me at my new room.    Room was really nice, big flat screen and really nice King sized bed.   Shower was heavenly.

We stayed two nights while attending a conference at a nearby church. We were with another couple, who had a room next to ours. We were all pleasantly surprised at the beautiful and comfortable accommodations. Everything was new and the room was exceptionally clean. We loved the rain shower head, the completely new bathroom fixtures, flat screen tv, and free wi-fi in the room. The location was great with easy freeway access and it was just a block from the South Coast Plaza shopping mall. Everyone on staff that we encountered was delightful. We'd happily stay there again.

I recently planned a weekend trip to Costa Mesa with my wife to see the Peter Pan play at the Performing Arts Center (play was amazing). We decided to check out the Hotel Hanford and we were not disappointed. The hotel was completely revamped and offers an elegant, stylish, and modern look. The room was very clean and comfortable; My favorite part was the showers. The pool area had a Vegas feel with the cabanas and the greenery was beautiful. The highlight of the hotel was the restaurant Savoy. The redesign was amazing as was the food and service. The seafood appetizers were incredible and the petite filet was also delicious. The bartender/waitor was very friendly and knowledgeable and the specialty cocktails he prepared were excellent. As far as i'm concerned when you factor in

Summary Heading: One of the best hotels I've ever stayed at
Summary: I've been traveling for work for over 10 years now, and I have to say without a doubt that the Hotel Hanford is one of the cleanest and most accomomdating Hotels I've ever stayed at.  I've been traveling to Costa Mesa for about 2 years now (every week), and I wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else.  The rooms are awesome, and Customer Service is hands down the best I've ever experienced.  Jennifer, Kenan, Joe, Stephanie, and last but not least Edward Moses (GM), always make me feel like the Hotel Hanford is my home away from home.  They do an awesome job of catering to your every need and I think they're the only Hotel that I've stayed at that makes everyone feel like a VIP.  I would recommend to anyone traveling to Orange County to stay at the Hotel Hanford in Costa Mesa Ca.

Summary Heading: You can put lipstick on a pig, but it is still a pig.
Summary: This converted Holiday Inn has a nice new paint job, however there are many things that are out of sorts in my opinion.  When was the last time you stayed at a hotel that did not offer coffee makers in the room?  When we were there we went into the on site dining facility which was actually a bar with a few tables, our party was about 15 or so but they would not reposition the tables so we all could sit together.  Said fire code and the ability to walk around which was laughable as to my count we were just about to the number the only ones in the place.  The filet was the worst I've seen in such an establishment small and tough actually it was more like a round steak.  The creme brulee was ice cold and overall portions were what one would expect upon a childs menu. How is it

Stayed just one night at the Hotel Hanford, but it was enough to get a taste of this lovely place. We were told that construction is almost totally complete at the hotel, though we didn't notice any noise or obstruction. This place looks new and smells new -- the latter might offend some. So if you have a sensitive nose, maybe stay at the Hilton down the street. We chose Hanford because we don't like huge chain hotels.   The staff are very nice and accommodating. I think they must be much less stressed now that construction is about complete. The rooms are nice, too! We stayed on a top-floor king room and LOVED the bed and the bathroom.   Had Happy Hour drinks and tapas -- yummy and well priced!

Having stayed at this hotel several times in the past while travelling on business from the East Coast, I can honestly say that the owners have done a fantastic job with all of the improvements and the complete makeover of the hotel.  It was a pleasure staying there.

Summary Heading: If customer service is important to you, stay somewhere else.
Summary: This place had the worst customer service of any hotel I've ever stayed at!  The front desk staff  were ill-equipped to handle even the slightest request.  When I asked to speak with a manager, (while checking in!) I was told no one was available!  I would have left and stayed elsewhere, but I had pre-paid online and of course, no refunds!   Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else!

Summary Heading: If it ain't broke, don't fix it.
Summary: The Hotel Hanford boasts of spending $7 million in upgrades during 2009-10.  Except for a large ramp built at the entrance to the lobby and fluorescent lamps in all fixtures, the "improvements" appear to be mostly cosmetic, adding nothing functional.  As someone explained to me, "What do you expect?  This is Southern California:  Everything is superficial!"    Even strategies which might have improved the hotel's bottom line, such as low-flow shower heads or a laundry reduction program, were  neglected.    In past years, when we stayed in this hotel -- known then as Holiday Inn -- we found a comfortable room complete with refrigerator and coffee maker.  Now the refrigerator is absent and the coffee maker was brought only upon special request.  During our five day stay I had to
Manager Response: Dear OldSolArizona,  Thank you for taking the time to submit a review on your recent stay with us.  As a new boutique hotel we take pride in offering the best products to our guests.  To that end we made the decision to offer our guests fresh brewed Starbucks Coffee delivered to their rooms from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm rather than have in room coffee makers.  On each bed is coffee card with up to ten different coffee and tea creations for our guest's enjoyment.  refrigerators are available upon requst and are quickly delivered to our guest rooms.  The new rooms and lobby are a wonderful departure from the very dated and predictable style of the previous hotel.  All of the room furniture was custom made for us and is of fine quality and workmanship.  I can assure you that nothing in the room is plastic, The armoire is solid wood as is the desk.  The fabric covered headboard and footboard is of great quality and a wonderful additon to the guest room.  The new lobby space is sleek and clean with elegant lines and soothing soft texures.  Many improvements have been added to the rooms including an organic line of bathroom amenitites in biodegradable pouches, thermostat control air and heat as well as thermostat controlled shower fixtures.    We at  The Hotel Hanford stand behind the changes that we have made and the ones still in planning and are very proud to offer our guests a wonderful alternative in the Costa Mesa area.  As for the "sick building syndrome" we have had wonderfully high levels of occupancy and this is the first incident of the kind I have heard of.  I certainly hope that you and your wife are feeling better.  Again thank you for taking the time to post this review.  Regards,

Summary: A wonderful refurbishment of what used to be a dated facility.  As of the end of July the east wing is undergoing refurbishment while the west wing is complete and fully open.  Photos on Expedia, Travelocity etc are old.  Look at the Hanford Hotel website to get the actual new look.  Staff are very friendly and helpful.  The restaurant has an excellent breakfast offering, far better than the "Corporate" hotels.  Wireless is available and complimentary as is parking.  A great place to stay!
